5n72h9G2WUneUTEMgLCzQg.text: WOW......the most authentic Mexican food I have had since eating my mother-in-laws home cooking.....sorry Nellie, Frank and Lupe' is better! A cute charming hole in the wall. If you are looking for upscale or Americanized Mexican food.....do not go here. If you are looking for the BEST authentic home cooked Mexican food, this is the place! Their beans are out of this world, not completely mashed and nicely smokey tasting. Their Spanish rice was the best I have ever tasted, not heavy on the tomato sauce at all but super flavorful. I also had a tamale that was again better than my M-I-L's and up to this point no one could make them as good as she does. The enchilada was good and OH MY the chips and salsa. The chips are thick but very crunchy and the salsa was amazing, not too spicy with a terrific flavor. I have seen reviews about poor service and bugs.....we saw NONE of that and the place was FULL.  The prices are also very reasonable. My combination plate that included a chili relleno, taco, tamale, enchilada rice and beans AND two sopapillas was only 13.75 and I had enough to take home for lunch the next day. If you truly know your Mexican food and love home style cooking, this is the place to beat!

LQxIr3AjvWby9AieQsWvDg.text: This is a fantastic place in old town. The food is very authentic and the green chiles are fresh. I recommend the enchiladas with poblano sauce. I have been to New Mexico several times and I think this is the most authentic New Mexican food in Arizona. Also, get a fried egg on your enchilada. Sounds weird but it's awesome.

8nsDQh9P8dOZ9kda6Z8dtA.text: Number 1 and a margarita..... Count it.  Best southwestern food around.

qDuhMBh2mGm6qi91Mbiy6Q.text: I've been to Frank and Lupe's twice now. The first time was part of the Scottsdale walking tour and we were able to sit down for about 20-30 minutes and enjoy some sopaipillas. The sopaipillas were very tasty and had a little bit of kick to them. I wish I had more when I left, even after I was able to eat half of my wifes.  Last night, I went with my wife and another couple for Happy Hour.  Happy hour is 4-6 pm and half price appetizers and margaritas.  AWESOME!   We enjoyed our food and drinks on the cool patio area.   The margaritas were very good and went down easy. As for the food, we went with the mini tacos, cheese crisp and mini chimicangas. The cheese crisp and chimichangas served with salsa, guacamole were good. I was a bit disappointed by the mini tacos. They were okay, but not great. Seemed like something you got at Costco, dropped in the fryer and served. Not much behind them.  The service was really good. Our drinks came out quickly after each order. The food took longer though. Given the food was just appetizers, I thought the food should arrive quicker. The food took upwards of 20 minutes.    Overall, 3.5 stars.  I plan to head back and have an actual dinner next time.

5y5Xi2Nc0Ci9Ef_0QnuU1Q.text: There is a difference between Mexican food and New Mexican food.  This restaurant satisfies our craving for New Mexican food.  Dining room is a bit loud and cramped but were just there for the food.  Recommend the stacked enchiladas with a fried egg on top (that's  authentic).

c3v1BEosBXVMkxjx8STNXA.text: If your looking for Authentic True Mexican then this is it!  I have tried all the "fancy" places in oldtown, and this place blows them all out of the water!  The food is AMAZING!  Everything is great!  I just moved out of state and crave them on the daily.  everything is so fresh.  The service there is a hit or miss.  I've had both, but honestly the food is outstanding that I don't care!  They could neglect me all they want and I would still bring my whole family there!  Please open a Frank & Lupe's in San Diego!  I miss it terribly.

l3rm1B3yRFfGnqkE8lkCZg.text: I love the location and ambiance of Frank & Lupe's but the food is just so so. I keep hoping I'll go and it'll knock my socks off but not so much.   If you want some kick ass Mexican cuisine head down Goldwater to El Molino Mexican Cafe.

I3Sy1NnFsK8Ve6emBqhVzA.text: Best chile in town ,the most amazing poblano dish in the  southwest.

afdwH4p9x9gRpqX6Bw3cLg.text: Great atmosphere in a downtown Scottsdale location. The price is right and the food is great.

CAamQ70T3a5fWS7qo-rmHg.text: This place is just damn good! Every time we come to Old Scottsdale we deal with the crowds, wait our turn and have some great tasting food at Frank & Lupe's.

g9DyGCyFMzY2EBsru6gTQA.text: I expected much better Mexican food from this place.  It was merely okay.  The salsa did not excite me, and the sauce on my green enchilada was just alright.  The service was rather.....Scottsdale (I was doing the server a favor by eating there).  It was clean and the vibe is fine, but I'm judging it solely on the food, and the plate gave me no yearning to go back again.

DNNAbwfjIQkGYuZ0b4NqCw.text: This is a solid Mexican food restaurant in Old Town Scottsdale. Frank and Lupes is traditional, and a little off the beaten path of other "mexican restaurants" in the area. The food IS top notch. I have taken family members there many times and introduced them to the restaurant, everyone is always pleased. When the weather is nice, the back patio is an ideal place to sit. Their margaritas are great!

ZJGLlNwfFgtMRm3fRzlUQA.text: I usually love this place and take all my out of town guests, but on Sunday we were disappointed. We ask for guacamole with our chips and they brought a very small cup of guac and no chips. It literally took an additional 5 minutes to bring out the chips, while we just looked at the guacamole. We got a pitcher of the house margarita and it tasted like mix. I got the combination plate, like i always get and it was not that good. Food was on the colder side and our waiter seemed like he couldnt wait to leave. We asked for to go boxes and he stood over my girlfriends shoulder and shoved it in her face.

jUhWdT9SgsezHCZ85DTuUA.text: Old Town Scottsdale is a mecca for three things: tourists seeking cheesy and sometimes obnoxious knick-knacks, twenty-somethings seeking overpriced novelty cocktails and easy ass, and middle aged well to do women spending money at boutiques while their husbands work to keep them wearing the current trends. Frank & Lupe's falls in the first category, appealing to the knick knack buyers after they are done shopping and have worked up an appetite.  That said, I thought I should try it on a Tuesday night with no plans. My initial reaction after seeing the drapes in the dining room was I would be in for an overpriced-underflavored meal that would only appeal to someone from Nebraska. Quite the contrary. I proclaim Frank & Lupe's one of the best (border style) Mexican restaurants in the Valley. The Green Burro owned and acutually contained fresh green chiles. their chips and salsa were also very tasty. The biggest surprise? the price was right in line with your Arriba, Abuelo's, Macayo's, etc. No complaints there.  The reason for the downgrade from four stars? the service. Quite frankly, the server, and server assistant that were assigned to our table were inattentive at best. They made no effort to give us exceptional service, and worst of all, every time I emptied my water glass they asked if I wated more. It's empty isn't it?

z4zWqZRGGN94rgnR1v9PJw.text: This was my second time here and I will say that the first time I went, it was such a great experience. The second time wasn't as good. My friend wanted a good mexican joint to eat with his family after his graduation. We had a large party of about 7 and so we called in advance. The lady on the phone said that they do not take reservations and that you just have to come in and wait. We were ok with until we showed up and then there was a large enough table that was empty that we could sit at; however the lady said that it was reserved and taken. I let her know that we just were told you can't make reservations and that you had to wait. This obviously upset us even more because the table that could have easliy sat our group was empty for at least another 10 minutes. Then 1 person showed up for the table and remained mainly empty for another 15 miutes at least. We were still waiting to be seated 30 minutes later.   The food server forgot one of our peoples food and brought it out later. I should also mention that the food took at least 45-60 minutes to get too. They did apologize on that but didn't seem to offer anything in return.   Although this place upset myself on my second visit and also upset the other people in the party, I still like the food here. It's a romantic setting (Back patio) and quality and filling food. If I had to rate just the service aspect I would give it 1 star, but since I am taking into consideration the food to go along with my first visit here, I give it 3 STARS.   Let's hope that my next visit goes better.

Lxb8Ybw0yaaeJ9IOpM7whw.text: The back patio at Frank and Lupes is such a gem to have in old town. As you walk down a small alleyway, you feel like you're walking in to a small family owned restaurant in a coastal town in Mexico. You're surrounded by walls painted with murals, a small bar, old school hanging corona signs, and not to mention great food. Really... nothing beats eating good Mexican food under the stars.  What I personally recommend:  Get the #1, it's the combination plate. It comes with a pork tamale, a rolled enchilada, a taco, rice, beans, and two sopaipillas. What I do is ask to sub the taco to a chicken taco. I also get my plate covered in red sauce. Ask for a side of salsa with your #1 to dip or pour on top.  Their chips and salsa are great. Many times I get served chips right out of the fryer in my basket. Their salsa is fantastic, and it's very fresh. One of my favorites in AZ. The only downside is their change in policy. In the past you used to get unlimited baskets of chips. Now you get 1 free basket, and I think every basket after that is $2.50. This is crazy in my mind, chips should be free. I asked one server why they started to charge, and he said it's because many people would just leave the chips on their table without touching them. What a weak excuse! Instead of charging, just ask initially if they would like chips. Their policy is just to get extra money...  Frank and Lupes gets 5 stars for food, 3.5 stars for service, and 2 stars for their policy. Their food is really good, so I cannot give this place anything lower than a 4.

vyz9XW875eaORLa1awuy9w.text: This was the last stop on the pub crawl.  Time for some sustanence (and margaritas) for most of us.  Time to throw up in the pushes for the birthday boy (and for a commercial pilot don't you think he'd have a higher tolerance - aren't they always drinking and whoring around - kidding).  The baby mama and I split some very nice enchiladas and I still maintain that it was the margaritas here that put me over the edge.  Regardless of that useless gibberish, they have nice drinks (big pitchers), good food, and lots of patio seating.  Useless tidbit:  there was a drunk guy in the bathroom with the door wide open taking his sweet time putting his junk away, proudly announcing (to anyone who would listen) that he was proud of what he had.  Dinner and entertainment.

ZYQ5K6n6e6Zv0k3gr5VdSA.text: My go to spot for steak tacos in old town.  Fresh every time. Comes with only beans which are delicious but I get half rice gotta have em both. When me and my Co workers want Mexican there's no question it's here. Still hot and fresh for takeout as well which is a plus for me. Great crew working there w great authentic Mexican food.

b76p7RoCymyFcDtp2TB6gw.text: We were looking for some great Mexican Food in old town and certainly didn't find it here.  The food was below average which was very disappointing.  The place looked like it was going to be great according to photos on the wall even Bobby Flay has met the owner I just hope he didn't taste the food.  The restrooms were located outside around the back of the building which sucked because our children had to go so that took considerable extra time.  The service was less than impressive as we had to beg for drink refills and table service.  They also forgot our desert.  Just an all around lame experience.

C-qhXJMV6aLbsDFRoxD5GQ.text: I've eaten here twice now - both times with a small group (party of 5 once and a party of 12 or so last night). I've sampled more than a few dishes and I've decided that they earn about a 3.5 for food and service (which is a bump up from my original assessment). I've given them a 4 because of their ambiance - specifically the back patio.   First off - the food. Everyone likes to argue over what "authentic" mexican food is and people bitch about how this or that restaurant isn't authentic so it's not good. That's a bunch of horse shit. Mexico is largely a poor country (as well as being fairly large) and their affluent areas have cuisine influenced by Europe while the rest of the country varies wildly depending on the region.   Authentic Mexican food is a mixture of cheap and fresh and spicy. They use foods that absorb flavors well and they use whatever is available that they can afford. The spices originated out of a need to cover up the fact that you weren't eating the best cut of meat or whatever. Authentic Mexican food isn't even that good or particularly good for you - if you spent some time deep in Mexico, you would be shitting your intestines out 6 times a day for a month or two until you got used to it.  Anyway - The argument really annoys me. You want authentic, then you should go to one of those shitty diarrhea inducing taco stands that litter the valley and that are run by authentic illegal Mexicans and that are often getting shut down for serving cat meat or for too many health code violations. Everything is made with lard and/or comes from a giant can and/or is cooked in a vat. Authentic. Enjoy.  This place is as authentic as any except they thankfully probably use higher quality ingredients as do most places in the valley. I guess compared to other local joints claiming to be authentic - I'd say this is closer in flavor to what you might expect from a higher end restaurant in Mexico than Tee Pee or whatever.   I grade Mexican food places mainly on 3 things - their chips and salsa, their shredded beef, and their margaritas. I don't eat beans, so I try to ask a friend who does what they thought so I have some perspective on that. I also try to test out their chicken, cheese and guacamole on a second visit.   Frank and Lupe's chicken was flavorless as was their cheese... they put it in a mole sauce which was decent. Their Margaritas weren't very strong, but tasted okay - they gave me a headache and put me to sleep when I got home. The beef had too much 'stuff' in it and I wasn't happy when I ate that. Some places cook their beef in stuff for flavor and then just serve the beef while others cook the beef and then mix it with cooked veggies and stuff for flavor. I'm a fan of the former rather than the latter.   Their chips were decent, but nothing special. The salsa was pretty spicy (when we asked for the hot), but it didn't have as much flavor as I like. So basicaly I wasn't wowed by Frank and Lupe's - I just thought it was "ok." The service was decent - everyone was very nice, but be prepared to wait for a long time. This place doesn't do fast.   Going to the back patio here is really nice when the weather is good or on a cool evening. It's a great little spot and a solid choice for dinner or a group having drinks and snacks before going clubbing. It beats the shit out of Pink Taco and Tee Pee though.   Fun fact: they don't take reservations (so they say) if the party is smaller than 20.

hdw9gICz2bEk-CX17zF1Zg.text: Mom & pop place that has been around for 35 years. You can't go wrong with any of the food choices here. Everything is homemade using Lupe's recipes. Lupe is from Mexico and Frank is from New Mexico. There is a wonderful blend of the two that make the food extra delicious. The service is top notch, as well as the bar offers excellent fare. Lupe and Frank's son Eddie spent time with us at our table and gave us a tour of the old house that is used for special occasions and celebrity privacy. He took us over to his families Monday night tradition and we were able to meet Frank & Lupe as well as more family and friends. This restaurant has heart and soul pored into every dish and in every nook and cranny. All the recipes are Lupe's "except the fish" she said. Don't think twice about trying this place, you'll be back if you do. The patio is our favorite place to dine in. If you close your eyes you can see and hear Guy Ferar and Mohammad Ali & his family over in the house.

photos.caption: Photo of Frank & Lupe's Old Mexico - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. The Patio. Get here early, it fills up quickly.

mFvNZuOiZ-V0DmH3FCXhrw.text: When you need to get out of the high priced  Scottsdale restaurant trap this is the place.  Mexican comfort food. I like the dive atmosphere, friendly service and overly cheesy food.  My wife won't go along, so my secret pleasure.

photos.caption: Photo of Frank & Lupe's Old Mexico - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

buoX9PED5PrV54twUKMYBQ.text: I don't see how it even has 3 stars.  Maybe the happy hour is great.  Ran in there with my wife for a quick dinner. The service was fine, not great but the food takes 5 stars  Americanized Mexican food. Bland! Tostada was nothing but unseasoned ground beef and store bought guacamole.   I should have tried their Green Chile. Maybe their New Mexican food has some flavor.  There are way better Mexican food restaurant in town!

b-l4WFHUwiY5WiCBOzXAHA.text: Having lived in Scottsdale since 1988, this place has been a staple of mine for years.  It seems that in the last year the place is falling apart from the inside.    With some family in town we decided to try it again.  It had been about nine months since our last visit.  During that last visit the service was so bad we wrote the place off.  This current visit made us run for the proverbial hills.  We will not return short of EVERY other Mexican restaurant within the 500 mile radius closing.    We got there on a busy Saturday around 5:30pm and just beat the crowd.  They said the patio had a 45 minute wait even though more than half of the tables were empty.  We asked if they were waiting for reservations on the empty tables, we were told they don't take reservations.  As we sat there, two different people walked up the hostess and asked if he could find their waiters.  All signs we should have caught.    After waiting 20 minutes, I walked around the to the front and found the inside of the place almost 100% empty.  I asked the host inside if the tables were open and he said yes.  Okay, no mention of the 10 open seats inside to anyone waiting on the patio.  So we moved inside along with about 3/4th of the people waiting with us outside.    After we sat nobody came to the table for a good 10 minutes.  We had to grab someone.  After we did, it took another 5 minutes before they made it to the table.  You could see why sitting there.  They had two waiters for the entire inside.  OK, the inside it small and it would probably work if the two poor guys didn't have to cover the bar, that had no bartender, and make drinks for their tables AND for the bar, in-between serving.  This all going on while the hostess stood in place and never lent hand.   The only time I saw him doing anything was then two irate people from different tables berated him about their lack of service.  Two more tables around us didn't waste their breath and just got up and left.    Our waiter came back once, about 20 minutes after we got there and took our food order.  Our drinks were dry and chip basket was empty.  No refills, no chips.  He didn't even inquire about us wanting more.    20 minutes later our food came from a different server/runner and we never talked to our waiter again.    We then couldn't get our bill for anything.  Personally, I would have just got up and left but the other people didn't want to pull a 'dine and dash'.    The last thing I'll mention is the filth.  I make it a general practice to not try to look at the state of the Mexican places I go to, especially the kitchens, but at this one the grossness just jumped out.  I won't go into details, but I stopped eating my burrito about half way though after seeing the kitchen door being held open by an employee for a few seconds.    It's a shame.  This place was a gem in Old Town and I recommended it many times.  It seems the times have passed it by.  While the staff works their under-staffed butts off, the management has obviously given up and the place is being run into the ground.  I see a Kitchen Nightmares in it's future.    Consider yourself warned.

rOWh9kxn6q-ALD2ttF_mdg.text: Always delicious, wonderful service and the back patio has a really nice ambiance. Their mango margaritas are so yummy!!!! It's a little on the pricey side but I love this place!!

6uWJ9Tqd3kTmyJj4nPVmow.text: Very good food. Small family restaurant. The reasonably priced. Desserts were amazing.

2-eVABp2265bcTBEh5UZlA.text: HORRIBLE HORRIBLE. Don't ever bother spending your time here. I was so disappointed for I was very excited to eat here. We put our name in for a table and another couple walked in and they sat them ahead of us which the manager said "sorry I didn't know what was going on" and still did not accommodate us. He said my bad and we waited 15 more minutes before leaving because they never sat us. We asked the manager to explain to us why this happened before we left and he placed the blame all on his employee. Horrible way to run a restaurant.

ao76nHtlNh9FPHG6nyN7SA.text: We love sitting outside, eating in the back patio. The food is good but the service will cause me to downgrade my rating.  My friend asked for a bourbon on the rocks and the waitress said they didn't have bourbon. So then he asked for a rum drink and she said they had no rum. I find this hard to believe because they have a full bar out in back. We were having a good meal but then the music came on and was so loud we had to shout across the table to each other. We asked them three times to turn it down and the waitress seemed put off by it. This really spoiled a good dinner. I would have given them 4 stars but the poor service knocks it down to a 2. It amazes me when restaurants don't realize that service is just as important as the food.

_nkEy5jFXtyQPfBZzuAnoQ.text: Great food, Lupe's enchilada is my favorite.  No draft beer, lousy service.  You can expect good food, just don't expect anything but minimum (poor) service.

7jbkGUaGG8g2mCBZab9_KA.text: While this place has a few really good items on their menu, the service here is very disappointing. We've been here a few times since I discovered their poblano cream enchiladas that are very yummy but will consider take out only from now on. The waitstaff is not friendly at all and seem to be very unhappy with their job. Management should really address this as I understand this restaurant has been here for quite some time.

AnYyHJjngFVfUvdBkbD07A.text: This restaurant is awful. Staff is extremely rude, inattentive. Food mediocre. Restrooms are filthy. We went on a Saturday night. No one would even take our name for over 20 minutes. The wait was excessive, the place was unorganized. Everyone was very rude. I was there a year ago and experience was decent but after tonight, we will never return.

G1UppThpNh0TLXjE1VvctA.text: I came here with a group of fellow native New Mexicans living in the Phoenix area, constantly searching for Mexican or New Mexican food that even HOLDS A CANDLE to what we eat at home. We basically consider ourselves Mexican food experts. We know what we're doing! Lol  I do have to say Frank and Lupe's puts up a good fight. I go into each Mexican joint with pretty low expectations, because I've been disappointed so many times in the past. But I was indeed pleasantly surprised!  Sat on the patio and loved it -- great atmosphere! Love the decor and lights in the palm trees. My group of friends ordered a pitcher of margaritas and were quite pleased. I ordered the combination plate with a rolled enchilada, tamale, a chile relleno, and a taco -- I wanted to sample several items at once. Oh and I ordered it with hot red chile sauce covering the plate.   Surprisingly, the red sauce tasted pretty close to what we eat in NM. I've heard lots of horror stories about Mexican restaurants passing off tomatoe-y sauces as red sauce. I was worried about what I'd actually get on my plate. But no, again, the sauce gets a thumbs up from me! The relleno was perfect, gloriously greasy and stuffed with gooey white cheese -- right on!   And the tamale was actually BETTER than most I've had back home! The masa surrounding the meat had this amazing texture to it and wasn't too dry or too moist. (I've had a lot of shitty tamales in my life!)   NOTHING outside of New Mexico is truly truly truly up to my standards lol. But Frank and Lupe's is, by a landslide, the best Mexican food I have had in my 6 months living in Arizona. I think I have finally found a place to satisfy my cravings and homesickness!

Ja3bhAWvgJIv0DKxHJZVfg.text: I was so upset during a recent visit to this restaurant. A good friend was visiting and wanted great Mexican. I was excited to bring her here as I'd had a wonderful meal on a previous visit.   We were told the indoor restaurant was not open yet but the patio was available. We waited in line behind one couple for a long time without being acknowledged. Finally they were seated and the host continued to ignore us. When we got his attention he said it would be 20-30 more until he could seat us. We were shocked as there were two open tables. He told us those were for groups of four and we were only two!  When we pushed the issue the bartender weighed in and agreed that we couldn't be seated. I was so angry and will not return. I guess zero guests are better than two?!?

QfuW-V9bNfvoJb0_8w2-lA.text: This place is gone so downhill, the food is awful, the service is terrible and it's so disappointing. This used to be one of my favorite spots years ago. I will never ever give it another try.

m2EfLUUS6KwuR_bes-d-mA.text: On  A quiet Tuesday night, the service was absolutely horrible. The inadequate waiter came by the table 3 times and never asked for a drink refill. The food was  almost inedible. It was blatantly clear that other parties of a different race had better service. I will never recommend this restaurant to anyone and will be sure to spred my distain for my entire experience.

t7A4nJOVRlXfLHJ4Y4uceA.text: We are at Frank and Lupe's last week. Sat on the patio and the host who sat us spilled a huge bowl of salsa next to our table. The salsa heavily splattered all over me drenching the entire back of my shirt from top to bottom, my hair and the front and back of my jeans. My actual back, which was covered by my shirt, was wet with salsa. It was gross. Our server was also present when it happened; however, he did not say a word of apology or offer anything to us.   The host offered me a little napkin, which was a joke as I literally had salsa all over me. I asked for a towel to wipe off all the salsa and the host came and started lifting the back of my shirt to clean it. I asked him to stop and asked my friend to help instead. The host seemed like he was drunk or on something- He wasn't acting normal. He apologized and asked if there is anything he can do. I suggested that he could discount or comp my meal as I now had to race home to change my entire outfit and wash the salsa out of my hair before our next destination. He said no.   Later he approached our table and (without asking) suddenly started pouring something random from a plastic cup into my margarita and said "I can do this!". I tried to stop him as he was pouring it. I had no idea what he was even pouring into my glass and honestly wondered if he was pouring his own drink into mine. It was weird!   He later came back and tried to do the same thing before I stopped him from touching my glass. I didn't even want to drink it afterwards as I had no clue what he poured into it. I tried to be a good sport about the major salsa disaster as I did not want to ruin my night with friends, but I feel the server, host, or manager should have offered something as an apology and show of good customer service. I understand that accidents happen, but offering a free meal to a customer that your employee drenched in salsa is a necessity if you want to have return business. But, nope, we were charged full price for everything, including our tainted margaritas.  It was my first time at Frank and Lupes. I was with friends who love the place, but I had a terrible experience there and felt I was mistreated as a customer. Based on my experience, I would not return nor would I recommend this restaurant.

fxfahEYZgRatGWRXjhVr_w.text: Yummy chicken enchiladas with poblano pepper cream sauce. Ricky made me a special margarita that was perfect. The patio out back is nice and away from traffic. On my way back again!

KTB30P9vbj2o5iQvZBHawQ.text: I had the #8, poblano chicken enchilada dinner, which was spicy and delicious. I also had one very expensive margarita and one glass of water. Refills were never brought or offered and we never saw the waiter after the food was dropped off except for a quick "need anything" and even quicker walk away before we could even answer. I don't expect fine dining service but at least come by with water when I'm empty and still have half a plate of food.

sIWT8Q67LHEgL2GvuphfNQ.text: Came here for dinner after bar and brewery hopping all day and really needed something to eat. Walking here there were a few other Mexican restaurants we could have gone to that had plenty of open tables. But we wanted to try Frank n Lupe's.  When we got there the place was packed, we were told there'd be a wait of up to 30 mins. Heard good things and wanted to stay. My party of four waited at the bar n enjoyed margaritas. I don't think we waited more than half a margarita before we were seated.   We were given menus, water, and chips n salsa immediately. The chips were freshly made and the salsa was delicious. I had the combo plate because I couldn't decide what I wanted. It hit the spot! Everything was tasty and flavorful down to the rice n beans. Others had the fish tacos and two different kinds of steak tacos. Everything was finished except I couldn't finish all mine and gladly took home some leftovers.  Overall this place is really good. The staff were all friendly. There's a really fun and well decorated back patio.The food was awesome. Margaritas did the job. Definitely recommend this place and will be back for sure.

aK-TAmZ4ZQssWSLv3_C19Q.text: First off, I will say the outdoor patio almost made this a 4, but I couldn't quite do it. But the patio is amazing and the cutest place to be in March in Scottsdale.  I walked here from the Valley Ho with some girlfriends, we were craving some Mexican food after a pool day.   The chips and salsa were really good, the salsa was spicy like I like it.  I got fish tacos, which I like to try everywhere because they are my favorite. I like that the fish was grilled, but the tacos could not be picked up because they were so soggy. I had to eat them with a fork and knife, which wouldn't have been bad but they didn't wow me. The beans and rice were better actually. The price was good for the amount of food though, $12 for 3 fish tacos, rice and beans.   You can customize any dish which was nice for my vegan friend.  I wanted to try and margarita because they looked great, huge fishbowl glasses. It looks like happy hour may be the time to try those.  Another thing I thought was weird was that there was 6 of us but our server said he could only split the bill 3 ways maximum. Good thing most of us had cash, still strange in this day and age though.  I thought it was good and I would go back to that patio again without persuasion, but not topping my list for Mexican food.

photos.caption: Photo of Frank & Lupe's Old Mexico - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Great Patio!

8cqZdEiQP1fnMEHtb4Enjw.text: Stopped in for lunch despite poor reviews. Service was snooty to be sure. My wife requested a shredded chicken burrito and was assured that the chicken was indeed shredded. Turned out it was fajita style chicken in a flour tortilla. The chicken was very bland and a little tough. My dish was equally bland. With all of the fabulous Mexican food choices in Scottsdale, this was a disappointment. We wont be back.

0ap04xxNWa3s-nY1k75Y2w.text: What a disappointment!! What happened to this place. I used to frequent this restaurant about ten years ago often. My hubby and I checked it out the other day while in the area. Food did not taste fresh at all. Beans were bland and tortilla was somewhat stale. The best part was the chips and salsa. I should have read the reviews before entertaining a visit. Place has a great vibe. Too bad the food is less than average. Customer service was good.

EJ696UVndlz7FpmnVRg1cQ.text: Fabulous flavors of New Mexico style food. Don't even think of ordering anything other than the #8. Best enchiladas ever, and I am not usually an enchilada fan.

K-8RNtfx8300eIN1peA8nA.text: Whether you're a local or tourist, you'll find Frank & Lupe's an enjoyable spot for New Mexican food conveniently located in Downtown Scottsdale.  I'm from New Mexico, so what I love most about the menu is that they serve sopapillas and stuffed sopapillas, both of which are hard to find beyond NM state lines. If you aren't afraid of a hearty meal, I highly recommend the Frank or Lupe enchilada plate.  The enchilada is crowned with egg - mmm!  Last night we had the special: chile relleno with poblano cream sauce.   It was massive, so between that and the complementary chips and salsa, my boyfriend and I had more than enough to eat.  Our server was friendly and efficient.  The small storefront facing Marshall Way has limited seating, but if you walk to the back of the parking lot you'll find another building and outdoor patio.  It's a great spot for sipping margaritas after a day of sight-seeing or having drinks and appetizers before a night on the town.  It can accommodate large groups as well.  In the winter they have heat lamps to make temps tolerable.  Opinions and styles of Mexican food vary widely in the Valley, but for me Frank & Lupe's is like a reliable old friend from home.

gVWAHlMbewBnDRCfSdh84A.text: Went there once wih a friend who was visiting the valley and wanted to show him around but wasn't so happy with choosing this place since I've never been to it. They didn't have many drink options that weren't soda or alcohol. When I asked the waiter said "lemonade?" (surprised they didnt say they had horchata!). The lemonade was literally a glass of tap water with one half of lemon juice and barely any sugar, for about $4. I ordered one of the cheapest meals they had since i wasn't so hungry, it was a plate of beef tacos with beans and rice for about $9-$10. Good amount of food for the price but the meat felt hard and a little overcooked in my opinion. The rice and beans were good though. I was in a group of about 8 people, and when they brought the bill it was only one bill....they didn't split it for us (so someone in the group who ordered a handful or margaritas decided to split the bill evenly with everyone even though i had ordered the least amount! just my luckkkkkkk right?) Anyway, there are plenty of pokestops around the area so that was cool.

36v7DBK8XA4hSnQH1CrRRQ.text: Last night was my first time at Frank and Lupe's. The ambience was nice and outdoor seating was comfortable. I was with a large group (almost 20 of us) and unfortunately the service was not as speedy as we were hoping. Our reservation was for 730 and we had our food by 9 or 915. We had one server taking orders and when food came he had some help but otherwise it was just one person. What such a large group size we understood we would need to wait a little bit, but what was most unfortunate was that the food came out and it was only slightly warm and my order was not as it was described on the menu. I let my server know that I was not as concerned about my order but that he should be more concerned that our guest of honor was clearly not happy.  Adding an automatic 20% gratuity for a large group is acceptable in most cases, however, i wasn't happy to pay it, though I did. Despite the cold meals, the only extra that was provided to the group was a free shot for the birthday girl. I gave 2 stars with hopes that it was just a fluke. I would try this place again, though only with a small group.

LaqDarzFjwwUoLxGWMhutQ.text: Food was fairly decent however there were some things that would make us think twice about coming back.   First, the fact that they charge for extra chips and salsa.  At least they let you know in the menu, however they say the first round is on them.  The first round consisted of two measly trays for 8 people.  Also, the server dropped a place of food on the table accidentally and enchilada sauce ended up in the lap of someone in our group.  They didn't offer to take anything off the bill (didn't even give us our 2nd round of chips for free!).  They were gracious with a couple peoples dislike of the enchilada sauce and were quick to prepare something different.

BNOOxU6ANgVOF_xMnZD8ag.text: This is one of those joints where the food overshadows the spotty service.  Anyone that reads my reviews, knows I'm sort of a salsa snob. And although I like their standard salsa that comes to the table complimentary, I LOVE their secret stash of hot salsa (you have to ask for it).  Not everything hits the bulls eye with me, but for the most part, F&L is good eats!  Their Santos Lounge is pretty cool and has a pretty impressive menu of tequila.   NATALIE'S F*#! the Recession Item:  HAPPY HOUR M-F 4-6p 1/2 Price margaritas 1/2 Price Appetizers

FY1LefQGF18sPOR2JiQjlA.text: We started at The Tortilla Factory. They told us the wait would be 1 hrs and 15 minutes. So we walked over time Frank & Luke's. We were told it would be a 35 minute wait.  1 hour and 30 minutes later we finally got a table. No apology, no grace or consideration. I hope the food is good

Rcv0fc6oq20xsZK5yLt45g.text: If you're going to try out F&L, I suggest the patio dining area. The inside portion is dirty, loud, cramped and your view is an eye-level of the parking lot.  The food is ok, but the service is horrible. With so many Mexican options in the Valley, it will be a long time before we go back to this place, if ever.

zL2gxAsLlFkCrVPxm38_Dw.text: in the order i noticed things:  1.dirty, sticky wall 2. large amount of ants crawling around the floor 3. my carne asada tasted like hamburger meat 4. FRESH lipstick on my cup  I wish i could have noticed our waiter, but he was never anywhere to be found.   NOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOO

photos.caption: Photo of Frank & Lupe's Old Mexico - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Ew

VsJvM6SJ1Z6SCaAH-SVyrQ.text: Found this place yesterday for lunch. I got a chimichanga and it was the best I have ever had! I could actually tell what I was eating, this may sound weird but  usually when you get a chimichanga at  most places you are kind of just trusting what they put in yours and you cant really tell what your eating. The thing I liked about frank & lupes is that my rice and beans actually look like rice and beans.    Good service and great food, one of my new faves for mexican food in scottsdale.

3tWCd5mf3GEV_JC70oND0g.text: Amazingly cute little patio place. Margaritas big, good, and strong (and so cheap during HH!) the service was average but the owner was amazing. I guess it's a family business since forever and they all work there. He chatted the whole time and was so friendly, helpful, and accommodating. I couldn't decide on their huge menu so he brought some sauces go try. The poblano sauce is really good. You can't go wrong with the poblano enchiladas. My only negative was the chips and salsa was not very good. Otherwise it had great food and drinks and ownership!

nJw1Q1-hh2Ex9GZA2xIUhw.text: Went to Frank and Lupe's for the first time yesterday with a couple friends of mine the food was really good authentic the service certainly did not exceed my expectations had to ask for things several times like water chips salsa and tortillas restaurant was not busy at all

y_9VdmlLPl-3_GcbmIFeFA.text: Went here after baseball game and was blown away by the great food, good prices, and amazing environment. A must go

MDS8sWPATga3Mq10xFYfcA.text: The stars I'm giving this place are for the food only. The chips and salsa were okay. I had their chicken poblano enchiladas and they were really ,really tasty. I went with my dad for his birthday because this is one of his favorite places to eat. I enjoyed the patio atmosphere also and hope the next time I'm in Arizona to eat here again.   The only problem I have with  the place is that the service was awful. Seriously, the worst. I would give the service 1 star or LESS .The waiter acted as though he was distracted the whole time. He never re-filled our chips. It took over 20 minutes to bring us our drink order (diet soda and ice tea) and we never got re-fills on our drinks either. He barely made contact with us to take our order. Thankfully I didn't have any questions for him because I'm not sure he would have stopped to answer them if I had. They were busy but only with a Sunday crowd. We didn't go on a weekend night when I expect delays and distracted waiters. This was at 5:00 on a Sunday. Thankfully their food is good and the atmosphere is nice because otherwise I wouldn't recommend this place based on service alone.  I just saw on some other yelper's review that chips and salsa are only free the first round. REALLY?  Maybe I won't be back.

HqMx07tF3seFXlYFHWoyoQ.text: I don't normally write bad reviews, but this place deserves one. I was sitting out on the patio with my brothers and their family and we got our drink order then about 20 minutes later we got to order our food. The server then did not ever come back to us until about an hour later and he said I am sorry the kitchen lost your food order. This would have been ok, if he was attentive and came back periodically to check on us, but alas he did not. He comped the drinks because I asked. I understand being busy, but as a former server, check on all your tables ever 10 to 15 minutes. I chose to leave and get a meal at home delivered by Postmates as I figured that would be faster. I used to eat here all the time because I worked at the Howard Johnson right behind it. These things happen, but not being attentive to your tables is inexcusable from a former waiter. Please do try working on this. At least the chips were good. Hope it gets better for the people who stayed.

aNUuN9vwS2d6h5vYwlfEvA.text: My favorite Mexican place in Scottsdale. Never disliked my food or had poor service.

I2BAXszMgSxUYt4BwwvJ8Q.text: 1st time here last night (finally). We dined on the "secret" outdoor back patio - thanks to my girls prior F&L experience (which is good, I would have never known it was back there). They have a nice outdoor bar area too. The ambiance was really cool, the menu is extensive, the food and drinks were about perfect.  Minus one star for slow service (I guess that's how it's done in Mexico anyway? take it slow... relax... or maybe I'm the one that should order a corona and slow down?).

t-75nDIZVX9eB17D9A4Uig.text: One of Scottsdale's hidden gems. Any place that can be open for over 50+ years has got to be doing something right. Not your typical mexican fare....this is "New Mexican" style. Much more flavorful and zesty! Had the number 8....probably the best mexican food I have eaten. Do yourself a favor and eat here. Not if you're counting carbs tho.

FuQA9HP1m-yExV5DTsWbAg.text: So authentic. So amazing. So delicious. The chips are on point, delicious and just damn addicting. Never seen chips like this. Not the old plain tortilla chips at major restaurants. You can tell they are freshly made with raw ingredients. The food was amazing and I wish I was here much longer than just a week. If me and my family came back for a visit this would be the first place we hit. You're food is amazing and so is your staff. AMAZING ALL AROUND. Everyone who is out of town should visit here.

8oYfSyJhiXEbb1KyqswkHw.text: This used to be my go to Mexican restaurant in old town, however, last two times service was mediocre at best, we like to sit on the back patio. Margaritas are very good. We ordered guacamole both times and for a Mexican restaurant they need to figure that one out, very bland and mushy, nothing added to make me want more. Chimichanga was splittable and was pretty good, nothing exceptional.

q2RrbTGqLBquzvrpUUe-hA.text: Give this place a try-I have been to Scottsdale too many times and came here for the first time just a week or so ago. I liked it- didn't love it-but didn't hate it.. I could certainly see it dependes on what time a day you come, who's on staff.. many variables- I will try it again- who doesn't like a patio, a margarita or a beer, chips, salsa.. vacation mode...some things I didn't like..but when on vacation.. just doesn't really matter.

photos.caption: Photo of Frank & Lupe's Old Mexico - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Look for this sign off the Main drag.
Photo of Frank & Lupe's Old Mexico - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Enjoy the outdoor patio.

8j2XaTY3xTTgrrtszLGn8Q.text: Cute little hole in the wall. Wish I had time to really check things out we only stopped in for a drink on the patio which was very nice.   Plan to go back and check out the food.

PrjndyBQeQYmPjzhebfAtA.text: HAIR FOUND IN SOPAPILLA.  Was excited to come here to relax on the patio, eat dinner, and have some drinks. We got seated right away, but the good service stopped right there. The waiter never brought us water the whole time we were there, after we had finished drinking our margaritas and chips and salsa we had to flag someone down after 15 minutes of sitting there empty to order 2 more! (And we were paying full price for them, not happy hour.)  The service was probably the worst we have had here. Never came over once to check on us, we had to go get someone if we needed something. Food was alright, we ordered the fajita burrito and it was small and not super flavorful. It was nothing to rave about.  The drinks were really good, and that's why I'm giving the 2 stars.  We also wanted to get dessert and unfortunately... we had a nice long black hair baked into our sopapilla.  Overall it was just a really bad experience and we normally like coming here and getting green chili and margs. Don't know if we will be returning unfortunately.

photos.caption: Photo of Frank & Lupe's Old Mexico - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

St2hxuf18P31UN7D1WneGg.text: Stopped by with my daughter, ordered queso and fajitas. Waited 40 minutes for the queso. Seriously annoyed because there weren't many tables full. Had some poor guy running around while the other stood around like a bump on a pickle. Never again.

GvPjagX4g3j98A6efV7k4w.text: Food tasted great!  However, I've never had diarrhea this bad for 24hrs after eating Mexican food. Also it took like 20 minutes to get someone's attention to get a refill on water.

-79XSdBhnJdZpfjxLS6hxg.text: Great find for traditional Mexican food. Chips and salsa are fresh and bottomless. Big servings of food for a fair price. I ate Frank's enchilada plate for $12 and pictured is a chicken chimichanga with rice, $14. There is a small indoor seating area and then a spacious patio seating area separate from that. The wait staff is nice and the environment is pleasant. Highly recommend!!

photos.caption: Photo of Frank & Lupe's Old Mexico - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

Zem8H-VR3UPSOfASG5oUfg.text: Had a great meal with family last week. Valley Ho Concierge recommendation and we were very pleased.Awesome Chicken Mole and Fish Tacos Margaritas were well received! Look forward to a return visit.

ZsZYugQtw_8utWp7daHcHw.text: Brought my grandparents back this past weekend and of course, ordered the chalupa. I freakin love this place, the chips and salsa are so good and we all traded bites of our plates, everything was amazing. We have high expectations for Mexican food and this place always hits the mark. I try to bring every visitor I have to this place because it's sooooo GOOD. Order the chalupa. Just do it.

Gi2JD5kO-1nNdd4eiWwZ3A.text: Ewww ewww ewww. This place is a disgrace to Mexican/new Mexican food. There beans have absolutely no flavor at last as of they came straight from a can. I would say comparable with Taco bells beans. I ordered the #5 lupes enchilada plate with shredded beef and asked for the green sause "poblano".   What I ordered did not look like a enchilada at all. And my waitress forgot the poblano sause and when I asked about it she was very rude and denied that I ever asked for it. Horrible customer service. There was berly any shaded beef on my so called enchilada. So skimpy. I also got sopapillas that were just plain old bread with nothing elts on them. I was told that I could not have sugar and cinnamon. I don't understand why if I'm paying for it.   For desert   I ordered flan. Worst presentation ever. They were small dinky prices. They were tastes so so dry and did not taste fresh. I have never had flan that bad in my whole life. El rancho and food city have more soft creamy flan then here.   I came with a party of 6 people answer none of use liked our food. Drove all the way from mesa just to try it out. Needles to.say say we will never come back with the bland food and the bitchh waitress.   One thing I will give them is that they have good salsa and chips. But that's about it.

Photo of Frank & Lupe's Old Mexico - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Flavorless enchilada skimpy meat. Bean taste like they are from a can.
Photo of Frank & Lupe's Old Mexico - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Nasty, dry, flavorless, falling apart flan I&#39;ve never had anything this bad before

M5HkztKNkc4Y-bObVvP9Kg.text: Monday happy hour visit was perfect!  Semi shady spot on the patio, a couple of the large happy hour special margaritas, chips & salsa, and a order of the chimichanga appetizers. The margaritas were strong enough to give us a nice buzz and weren't too sour.  The chips are good and the salsa is better. Had to ask for some extra salsa to go with the chimichanga minis.  Six mini chimis, cream fresca, pick, and guacamole make up the plate. The chimis were meaty and tasty. We were to full for dinner. Yes, we would go again.

PHNMI-yBLFhIdWk7uVTJIg.text: Horrible service!!!  Walk in and be ignored. They had plenty of seating but because there were only two of us they chose to ignore us and take larger parties first!  Unfortunately I will not be back!!

jUTZKVPMJRghj2BYH1DIZQ.text: Came back.  Again.  My Mexican husband came for the first time. He said "(something in Spanish that sounded like he liked it)"   Try the mole sauce with the #11 chicken taquitos.

zJymRO0FLWGvq4_SON2WKA.text: Great food super fun love the sopapillas. Will be back with the group. Beers are cold and delicious.

3ZbN53phiozz0TTkFseEfw.text: My husband and I went here on a referral from a friend. We really enjoyed the restaurant, friendly service, food was good. I had Chili Rellenos, the plate was hot, the rellenos were not, just warm. The flavors were great though. Husband had tacos, and he liked them, said they could have had more spice for him, but he was satisfied.

yqNhJ3GqogbE6-ZaLKOd_A.text: It was packed on Friday. Luckily we got the table quickly before people started to have to wait in line. The food came out fast. The meat was so juicy and tender. The beer+margarita is interesting when we saw the beer bottle sticked out of the normal margarita glass.

hiMqj4qrqXQ6d1RkxKVqww.text: Waited about 40 minutes to be seated after being told 20 Minutes. We had a party of 11 and the staff was extremely rude during the waiting period. One staff member a male was many rude off hand comments to me and. My children while in the waiting area about them. Being in the way. There is  one real space for the kids to stand except where we were. After being seated we didn't get enough chairs it took forever to get chips and salsa and people who were seated after us got there meals before us. At one point in the night the server who was rude to my children and I earlier was bumped don't and his tray of food fell into a women's lap. It was not the servers fault but he was very rude and u apologetic and even hot I  a argument with the lady at the table. He kept saying he didn't feel bad because it wasn't his fault. He probably said that about 7 times and he kept escalating the situation. I understand it wasn't his fault but he works for the service industry and should of said sorry and let tit be instead of making a scene and not showing a ounce of emotion. He was very Rude an d it made the entire difference nervous uncomftorbale. A manager never came out to apologize to the ladies at the table or anything it was pathetic. There was a server who helped them at the end who was amazing g he was a tall skinny male he was amazing but he was the only friendly face that I saw in that place.   The food was OK... Nothing to call home about.

db0CxNqkX7yjRWS8jI-fSQ.text: A few of us stumbled upon this "hole in the wall" Mexican restaurant while walking around Scottsdale & I'm glad we did! This was by far the best Mexican food I've ever eaten (albeit were from the Midwest). The chips were so light and airy and the salsa tasted amazing with great consistency - not too spicy but it had a nice kick to it. I ordered the chicken chimichanga and loved it! The rice that came with it was delicious too! My wife ordered the (3) soft tacos and ate them all - she never does that. And my brother had a combo and he raved about the tamales. The service was average, and the meals were costly ($55 for 3 of us) but other than that we were very satisfied and would recommend checking out Frank and Lupe's to anyone visiting Scottsdale. AZ!

vXf7ZmNobNPXqfM7mj_75A.text: This place was highly recomended to us by our hotel. There are many Mexican Restaurants to choose from in the area so we trusted our hotel staff. Our meal overall was good but it was super busy and we had to request and remind our waitress a couple times for things. She seemed overwhelmed but nice. The food was average Mexican food to me (I ordered fajitas) but my husband loved the chicken mole and the margaritas. I had a very delicious mango margarita. It seemed to be a popular locals spot and decent price range.

5m214DCCqmuN9yBEaDmlXA.text: I like this Mexican because they don't use lard and everything tastes fresh and homemade. Love the re fried  beans, tacos, enchiladas and chips.  The margaritas are great and they have a fun patio. This is our Mexican food go to and you should try it.

wnvFPyojCT4_WUkTu68VUg.text: Ordered the green corn tamales that were very dry with burnt corn kernals.  I have been to much better places for half the price, I should have read the reviews before I went. The waiter only served us and then left only returned with the bill. Tucson has the best food worth the trip.

X9_vmz6tWhPgVE-1sEvOxg.text: Don't bother coming here. Scottsdale has so many other great places to eat. The patio was cute, but the misters were not turned on which became very uncomfortable for a hot Arizona summer night...inside seating is available. The one star was for our service and food quality. Our server forgot to put my order in and got my friends order wrong. Rarely checked in and had to call her over a few times. It was not very busy in her section, so no reason for her to be unattentive. Expensive and not that great. A MEH experience at best for a $70 tab.

photos.caption: Photo of Frank & Lupe's Old Mexico - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Super nachos. Good but not enough chips.

o6fVGgWa7sHn6wdbAWdk_g.text: we asked a store owner to recommend a lunch place, and here is where he sent us.  The menu was full of interesting dishes, be we stuck with the Tacos, and Carnitas. We asked if the green sauce was hot, and they said no....... but beware!!!  we had to scrape it off our food, I enjoy spicy food, but this was WAAAYYY too much! Other than that, we had a good meal. I really enjoyed eating outside on the patio, and I can imagine this place is a fun bar to take friends to. The price was reasonable, and the service was good. Good choice!...... just no green hot sauce!

4nNyB4a0VDu2dWbkbryZhQ.text: Just had dinner!     Had #31 the Chicken Mole Enchiladas.    Simply amazing mole sauce.    Thoroughly enjoyed it along with a couple Bohemias.    Will be back next time I am in Phoenix/Scottsdale area.   Not a fancy place - but food was great which is what it is all about.

Pj4usSwI7gUq03xBShyM3Q.text: Stale chips, jar salsa, fish tacos covered in oil and cheese, kids chicken nuggets from Costco in dinosaur shape. Positive side was a really good house margarita and friendly service.

E9RTqK8SAIsXxQrLKLY23Q.text: Awful experience. I was part of a large group of mostly out of town guests. We arranged to visit the night before and were assured they could accommodate the size of our group (35 people).  The food was decent but nothing special. The service was HORRIBLE. When a complaint was made to the "manager" the service got even worse.   Overall, there are too many other options in Old Scottsdale than to waste your time and money here...

JDp2UxGUKllFanobi1qwnQ.text: Great place for lunch, service is always polite and chicken chimi plate rocks. Grab a beer and bring a friend for an enjoyable time. Place is always full lunch time though so you may have to wait.

RFo0pggMeSj6GEKIFSi5jg.text: First time and definitely will N.O.T. return. Food was mediocre. Service was extremely poor. And price was nothing to brag about.   Two of my friends and I arrived around 4p today and sat out in the patio. They didn't seem very busy but maybe the bartender was working the bar and tables. Service was extremely slow. We ran out of chips and salsa before our order was taken. The bartender did not refill the chips until our food came out and we actually had to ask for it. So you know how long that took.  Our drinks were empty for 15 mins before we were able to get the bartender's attention to ask for a second round. We weren't even given any water.   I wasn't very hungry and ordered and mini tacos from the appetizers. There was no description under this item. When I put in the order, I asked for the mini tacos with beef. The bartender confirmed and said "shredded beef". I said "yes". They brought out mini chimichangas. When we told the bartender, he said they didn't have mini tacos with beef, only mini tacos with bean. So when I asked for "beef", he just took it upon himself to put in the chimichangas. Who does that? Apparently, I should have been familiar with the kitchen and the menu. It did not occur to him to tell me, at the time he took my order, that they did not have mini tacos with shredded beef? Or even explain what came with the mini tacos since there was no description? There was nothing else on the menu that seemed appealing so I told the bartender to bring the chimis back.   Now, it had only been 2 mins from the time they brought out the chimis, took it back into the kitchen, and brought it back out to me. Yet, the chimis were already room temperature. Which probably meant they had already been sitting around before they were brought out the first time. Some of them were soggy at the bottom. I could not finish the plate.   When the bartender gave us the check, he charged us for the chimis. This seemed a bit unreasonable since it was his mistake to begin with. When we asked him to remove the chimi from the bill, he said "you ate it". I told him I didn't order it and it was his mistake (that I had to eat it). He snapped the check presenter from my hand. When he returned with the corrected check, he threw it down in the table.    Perhaps Frank and Lupe aren't concerned with hiring smart servers. Even the bus boy seemed smarter and more polite than the bartender.

DvngQZ3ixAqpAhrF3oE7WQ.text: Literally the worst. The service was shitty and they took 2 hours to get our food..TWO HOURS!!! They weren't even busy! They served other people food before they served us and there were more people than our group that got served...And even if it was running late--the server never updated us!! We had to keep asking. It was also my friend's bday and I asked them to bring a dessert at a certain time and they literally brought it out 20 minutes after I had to remind them again. When it came to the check we had issues trying to pay separately and had to get up and give the waiter our cards which we suggested..since he wanted us to put the bill on one card and told us that the computer doesn't print checks separately. And when I told him to swipe the card a certain way and charge two meals one check it's as if he wasn't listening because he kept saying how the "cards didn't work". The whole service was ridiculous. Food was alright but not worth all this. Never going again.

nIRmU_iQfeJ6MmF8HtCmuw.text: I have been here twice.  The food is really good...the service, not so much.  The first time, the waitress was swamped, so we gave her some leeway.  This time, the server looked like he'd rather be anywhere but serving our table.  My friend ordered a drink which he had to remind the server twice to bring.  He rarely came to our table and when we asked him about desserts, he just about rolled his eyes and sighed.  But...the part that will cause me to not go back to Frank and Lupes -- There were ants on the rim of my water glass.  Dead, but still ants.  I showed it to the busboy who promptly took it away, but still...ants.  While the food is good (the salsa is yummy!), I am disappointed in the service and the cleanliness.

lvFu2Aicb93bcERO-ScDwg.text: Excellent food and sit on the patio!  Super fun and we frequent the restablishment several times per month.

mcV9-MblQHYBHBA7NrOSCg.text: We are originally from New Mexico and appreciate good Hatch green chili.  This restaurant has the 'real deal.'  Chicken is all white meat and not dried out.  Prices are high and parking was a nightmare but overall, we enjoyed our dining experience.  Would definitely go back.

t3vHVR2aAdldp4_t8714TQ.text: One of the absolute best Mexican restaurants that I've been to in the U.S. Simply amazing. Very small and quaint atmosphere. The prices were awesome and very affordable. I enjoyed the authentic Mexican beer and their beans and burritos were one of a kind. As soon as you step out of the restaurant you have an awesome view of camelback mountain.

photos.caption: Photo of Frank & Lupe's Old Mexico - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Awesome shrimp and chicken burrito
Photo of Frank & Lupe's Old Mexico - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Great Authentic Mexican Beer
Photo of Frank & Lupe's Old Mexico - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

KIpnF2WoHqKmCmcuEWJFAw.text: This was recommended to me by a fellow Las Crucen who knows what good mexican food should be.  I am very picky with my mexican food in Arizona, so I was doubtful about Frank & Lupe's, but it did not disappoint!  If you can & it's not too hot, try to sit on the back patio.   You will feel as if you have been transported to Mexico.   The red chile is flavorful, about as close to mine & my mom's.  They have Victoria beer on tap, which you don't find anywhere.  This is legit New Mexican food!

-SmlTWXU1lxmfso9ACap3w.text: Great Mini chimichanga, pitcher of Margarita. Chicken enchiladas with creamy Poblano sause. Mole enchiladas are a bit spicy but I like it that way. Nice background music and fast service buy they don't rush you. The patio is like your at home.

dz4CqgbDi4YN4Oo9zLf5Qg.text: I had the queso dip and fish tacos and they were very good! Excellent pricing and service. Thank you!

PkbN1ylnbswSwTKE_g_TJw.text: This place is a solid, good, and rather typical Mexican restaurant:  The margaritas are good, fair priced, and also come in pitchers, the decor is slightly tacky, when you are seated you get fresh chips and salsa, and everybody seems to be on 'island time'.  The one thing that really does it for me at Frank & Lupe's Old Mexico is the patio!  That is why I keep coming back.  I should also mention I think 'Frank and Lupe's' is a cool name and fun to say.  If you are in a hurry don't come here, but if you want to lounge on the patio and have a leisurely lunch with a margarita in Old Town, well then, Frank and Lupe's is your place!

o6M2g4GkWsXhHEA28Xuiog.text: This was my first time at Frank & Lupe's.  I grew up in So. Cal. So I have been in my share of some great Mexican restaurants. The atmosphere is of a charming old style Catina...nothing fancy but very relaxed feel. The four top signs of a good Mexican restaurant are... Salsa Chips Beans Rice....they all were great!!!! The plates we ordered had good flavor.  Love to be able to taste fresh spices, onion, and cilantro.   Our server was Michael and he was always there at the right time. It is the kind of place you do not want to be in a big rush to eat.  Sit back and relax on the patio!!!!  I would recommend.

8Fz1wYgAhi4FjlOohyLJcQ.text: From the look of some of these other reviews, it looks like cleanliness and customer service are not amongst the priorities at this restaurant.   Like some other reviewers, one of the guests in our party found a dead ROACH in their drink that ruined our entire dinner. Since this doesn't seem to be a rare occurrence, I feel obligated to warn others and post this review.  Unfortunately, this wasn't the worse part. After telling our server that this was completely unacceptable, we waited another 15 minutes before the manager on duty would speak with us. I explained that we had to cut our dinner short and that we didn't feel comfortable paying for the meal.  If this happened at any other establishment, the meal would be comp'd. But, at Frank and Lupe's, service isn't exactly their main concern. The manager continued to insist that he couldn't give any further discount than 30%. I re-iterated that this was a matter of cleanliness and that our entire dinner was cut short as the rest of my party was completely disgusted and had lost their appetite.   The manager wouldn't budge and claimed the owner would fire him if he gave any further discount (?). Since we didn't seem to be making any progress, we begrudgingly paid the bill and left. I sincerely wanted to walk out of there and not pay anything.  I understand that things can happen but, management should have done the right thing. Not to mention, someone could get sick from the way this kitchen is kept. I will never, ever go back to this restaurant again. Absolutely disgusted...

Yph0eNSOwlvJgwyB1DN0dw.text: This place is a joke! They told us we had to wait 45 min for the patio. I counted 4 open tables! Then we went back inside and then waited 15min to have a server who was frantic because he was obviously one of 3 servers for the entire place.. The hostess got yelled at by another table because no one was coming to take their order. And as they left they too said Bad service!hire more servers! loud enough for the whole place to hear. Our food comes out, its ok.... Nothing to spectacular. Don't waist your time here. Its a dump!

4prup-GsFqFU0PBnl6jaVg.text: I have dreams about their poblano enchiladas. (Why do I love food so much?)   (Seriously, send help.)  The food tastes like your Nana made it with love ... if you had a Nana. I have a grandma ... she makes Swedish meatballs. Anyway. If she did make enchiladas drenched in a creamy poblano sauce, she would make them like Frank & Lupe's makes them. It's even better when enjoyed on the patio.

3LAxfON7Bhor8qGmg2HT4w.text: My favorite patio in the city. Something about it is very peaceful. Good food, always friendly service.

Hdkl9mJb-C3uohhcERd7QA.text: We've been going to Frank & Lupe's for 5 years. We love their food. Sitting in their patio relaxing w/ a margarita seems like your in Mexico on vacation. The only reason I didn't give 5 stars, is due to service. It can be hit & miss. The last few times it's been great....so maybe there's been a turn over in staffing? The guys working the packed patio last Saturday did a great job!!!  Regardless, we love this place!  Try #25 w/ both shrimp & chicken.....it's awesome!!!!  Also, the ceviche & mini taco are really good.

bezd9CTj-ltxC2O3IR68aQ.text: This is our go to family Mexican restaurant.  Can't believe it took me so long to review.  The chimichanga is the bomb and the tortilla chips are some of the best in town.

GL2K_JYO1QLKR9Gc7YqdTA.text: I remember coming here a few years ago and really liking it, so when Deal Chicken had an offer for $15 for $30 worth of food and drinks, I grabbed one. I finally went to use it yesterday and was pretty underwhelmed.  Things started off great. My boyfriend and I got there at around noon on Sunday, and since the place wasn't very crowded, we were allowed to pick where we wanted to sit. Our waiter promptly took our drink orders and brought us out chips and salsa. The chips were amazing! Probably some of the best I've had at a Mexican restaurant.   Since we had $30 to spend and weren't drinking, we opted to get an order of mini chimis to start. The meat inside the chimis was pretty good, but the chimi itself was disappointing. It didn't have that typical crisp that fried things should have, and it was actually kind of soggy.  For our entrees, I got the stuffed sopaipilla with carne adovada and red sauce, and my boyfriend had the smothered bean and cheese burrito with green sauce. The red sauce was good and super spicy, but the meat was pretty dry. I was thinking a "smothered" burrito would be covered in sauce, enchilada style, but instead it just had a spoonful of diced green chiles thrown on top. The burrito was okay, but the rice on both of our plates was pretty bland and some of it was still crunchy and undercooked.  Right after we got our entrees, the place got pretty crowded and our waiter seemed to forget about us. We wanted to get dessert, but it took so long for him to just come by and clear our plates that we opted to just get the check and go.  If I was in the neighborhood and was really craving Mexican food, I might stop by. But I definitely would not drive out of my way to come here.

kzqKJipdjeXkRg05xFAdyg.text: Great Huevos Rancheros and a beer for under $15. Staff was super friendly and welcomed a tired traveler like myself with a smile and treated me like family. Great back patio as well!

s-JjZi6KnfIdxJcm_Q9fHw.text: This is my favorite new Mexican restaurant in Arizona. The number six special is my regular. Having lived in New Mexico this place reminds me of home and I can get my chili fix whenever I need to.

FqfvnNbDnb4TLQSKYm1Qjw.text: WOW this was a awesome place the service was great and my steak tacos were to die for! OmG

photos.caption: Photo of Frank & Lupe's Old Mexico - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. All gone!! It was SOoO gOoD!

6udJ-0wJo19GjM992xtBJQ.text: Ordered a large margarita, which was okay, nothing phenomenal. Shrimp enchiladas was not up to par. The enchilada sauces came on the side and didn't taste yummy. Chicken tacos had bland chicken and came on crunchy shells, which was unexpected.  Rice and beans that came with both meals were disgusting. Things that come out of a can tastes better.  Chips & salsa only free the first round. The chips were good, but salsa was probably one of the worst I've had at an "authentic" mexican restaurant, so i'm really not sure why they are so stingy with it.  Service: the place was full, but in the 15 minutes that we stood inside when NOBODY acknowledged us, 3 tables were cleared. Only when a family of 8 walked in and crowded the whole place and they were FORCED to talk to us did we get seated.   The waitress at the end also tried to overcharge us. I left her an awful tip. Here's another tip: make your food better, and have better service, and stop trying to rip off your patrons!

j3iRxti6k0F7fsYrJ0CLVg.text: My fav. Place to get some Mexican grub! I recommend heading out to the patio side to get a fun environment while dining. The owners and staff are wonderful and never fail me for a good time at their restaurant! I love unwinding with one of their margaritas and my munching on some yummy chimi's! I also recommend the mole!

VQid1x1MASr8_Pz6S5CMiw.text: If you enjoy being treated "brusquely", then this is the place for you! We sat at the bar to get a quick dinner before beer festival. We asked about happy hour specials, and we were told that margs were half price. Hooray! The bartender didn't mention that there was no happy hour that day, so we paid $13 for one marg made from the bottled green stuff branded Chi-chi's, I think. The younger bartender wandered away to ignore us at the register. The older one came to take our order; we ordered the mole chicken to split. $16 for half a chicken didn't seem to be outrageous to split. She walked away, leaving a menu. She did not acknowledge our order or ask any questions, just meandered off. My daughter wanted to order another drink, but could not get the attention of anyone behind the bar who were literally 2 feet away from us. The food took a while, but it was good. If you enjoy being treated rudely, I recommend you go to Frank and Lupe's immediately to get your share of abuse.

F52LJWLPNui2kjyA_GyaHA.text: This does the job when I need a fix of New Mexico red chile sauce!  The #14 combo and add a relleno!  That's all I'm going to say...make sure you get an egg on top so it's authentic! ;-)

n9yxSlNHZcYX7j_rFh1yXQ.text: Revision: We tried again. Maybe out of habit & were disappointed again. Why let this go down so much... Please get your act together. I've was a customer for 6 years but the last 5 or 6 meals were not enjoyable. The Chili Relleno has gone from bad to worst; they make them in the morning for that day's service & when they revive them, they are greasy. The Sopapillas use to be something to look forward to but lately are undercooked... one was not even inflated. Whatever they changed, it is not for the betters. I'm taking my money elsewhere. JJ

mItPpvBL5n0yq-dH-t5W9w.text: Service was terrible. Had to ask multiple times for just a glass of ice water after sitting at out table for ten minutes. The host was useless as well. It's June the off season and wasn't even busy. Food was okay, but not as good as it has been in the past(6 months ago and a year ago).

a4tCnh842bmWbauZdiPDbw.text: Wow, this place is bad. The food is very bland, and the service was horrible. I ordered the Carne Adovada burrito, and it wasn't good at all. Stay away.

4HQbHmlZbN0xfJ3wbeEY7A.text: While on a trip we were directed to this restaurant.  I will say in advance that I cannot handle really spicy foods, but my husband can. Hard to find a Mexican restaurant that we can agree on.  We were seated inside since the patio was not open. I hope to time it differently next time, the patio looked like a fun place to be.  Our meal was great and the server very patient with us. Great suggestions.  I was so excited about the green cream sauce that was on my meal. It was surprising that they put the recipe on their website. How great of them. I have made it twice since we returned home....I don't have it down pat, but still really good. I look forward to returning again.

reFJc9cdcKBu0GIa6O6T4Q.text: Solid old school Mexican food that gets the honorary "TeePee" half star upgrade due to its historical value to the community.  Unlike several other reviewers I've never experienced bad service.    The food is solid and the sopapillas make my "best of valley" dessert list.

LwtnTEQSMqEB3yulHHLcRQ.text: We go to Frank & Lupe's at least once a month. We always have a great meal. Their chips and salsa are very, very yummy. Margaritas are also very tasty.   Service can be a bit slow sometimes, but given how busy they always are, it is understandable. We will always wait for good food. You should too.....

uHzF2VzXE24eSAQ4bLpNnQ.text: This has been our favorite Mexican restaurant for 20 years,  NO MORE.  We ordered enchiladas and got a skinny cheese burrito.  Mine had mole and chicken on top and my wife's had a couple of soggy  vegetables on top. The kicker was I spent the night in the bathroom.   Never again.

DL9xDgoEeCzGVXFpeE-mNg.text: Good food but terrible service. Margaritas are overpriced at $17 and poor quality. Undrinkable took them back and waitress said it was because we use real juice. Yeah right Waitress last night  had an attitude very unpleasant. We won't ever go back.

p9wV57IzvKN1eOaReQoBbA.text: Timing is everything, so some say. When your appetizers show up with your meal, your timing is off.  Good news? We ate every thing, meals and appetizers. Please try to do a little better coordinating the timing of your customer orders.

I4-Nahh1C1oRjHSey-t03Q.text: What a great place!!  We went Saturday at 11 am when it first opened and sat on the patio at the bar. We were the first customers there. It soon filled up. Great atmosphere.   The food was excellent I had the number five my husband had the number eight. We both loved our meals.  The service was excellent.   So happy we found this place.

photos.caption: Photo of Frank & Lupe's Old Mexico - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Frank & Lupe's Old Mexico - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Frank & Lupe's Old Mexico - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

qb845Vt0An5cNWQYSh7QAw.text: Must sit outside on the patio. The chili's were very good. Just the right amount of masa and very moist.   The house margaritas are delicious. Traditional Mexican style with fresh squeezed lime and not sweet.  Recommend asking if items are spicy. Not necessarily denoted on the menu.

eiHfOsh9EXbxxZ4cY_0wbg.text: Took 15 minutes before our server got to us. He was rude and acted like we were a problem. Food was oka but not the best.  Being a server in the past I understand a lot but didn't even check on us one time.  Didn't get a refill.  Didn't ask anyone to check on us. Couple behind us waited 30 minutes just to get a bill.   Another couple was complaining on the way out. Spend your money somewhere else.

bYC5N0-BZ-hjWXNGsrRcNw.text: My husband I both grew up in NM and this tastes like home. Nothing super fancy but good margaritas and spicy green Chile. We were very pleased with our meal and service

u2QIwOrt6XO2gl_7Rnv8BA.text: Greeted by a friendly guy. He was also the waiter for the little bar they have.  Tvs playing espn and the game, which was nice.  Gave recommendations. The food was fantastic. Poblano cream chicken enchiladas were amazing. Had this fantastic green sauce on it.  And the Cadillac margarita had a great mixture.  Good flavor with the tequila he recommended.  Only downfall it was a bit overpriced.  However a very cool little atmosphere.  Def recommendation for this place.

T5jH_bWuYReB5ub2s6iMkA.text: WHAT A HORRIBLE EXPERIENCE! Sat there for nearly an hour, other people coming after, eating and leaving before we were ever served. Waiter was never around to inquire after our order, nor offer chips for the overly long wait. When we finally got it it was thrown together like an afterthought and tasted mediocre at best. I tried to tell the waiter it wasn't what I ordered and he just kept saying "yes, it's good, it's fine".
