I ordered an enchilada and got an open-faced shredded taco with a sunny up egg on top, no enchilada sauce and no cheese. Then he insisted he gave 20% off due to its late arrival but it was just $5.00 off of $52.00. In what world is that 20%?! When I told him we were very dissatisfied he, again, said "no, it's good, it's fine", like he was telling us how we should feel about the whole experience, very dismissive. When we asked to speak with a manager he finally reduced the bill further, but even free isn't worth such a frustrating experience for mediocre food. AVOID AT ALL COST.

dIeo9KprepdxILYHXJgr8w.text: I was visiting Scottsdale and wanted to try some authentic Mexican! Found this place and irrespective it has 3.5 stars on yelp I thought let's give it a shot! I went in and asked a lady in front to be seated - she made me seat on a side not close to window and since the whole restaurant was almost empty I asked can I get seat close to window since there were a lot of them! She rudely said you can get either this or bar! I felt rude but took the seat! She comes after 2min and asked so ok I can make you sit on the seat near the window! Very very rude she was!   Then someone came to take my order! He was in Rush as if he has to catch a train! He took my order, never checked for any more salsa, or if food is ok or I need more water or any other drink!   In food I ordered veggie burrito rice and bean! It was very ok taste wise! The only thing I loved was salsa and chip! If I ever go back to this place just because of that! I am sure though there are other places to try in Scottsdale!

303e2XtyHE3cp5qOGN-SFg.text: We hadn't been to Frank & Lupe's in years, so decided to try it again after seeing it on one of the best Mexican restaurant lists in the Phoenix area recently.  We decided to sit on the patio since it was such a gorgeous evening.    Nice, relaxing vibe on the patio, friendly service and tasty food.  The homemade chips and salsa are delicious and addictive...beware!   I ordered the ground beef stuffed sopapilla with rice and beans - good, but not as good as Maria's (but that is truly hard to beat)!  Definitely worth a visit while in Old Town Scottsdale.

QL4FOzaQ61OsIMZf9sZ7tw.text: We made the mistake of coming here AND bringing future in laws fresh off a long flight with us. We saw reviews and thought hey this place is good, close to the hotel, let's go seems OK and we are in Arizona why not get Mexican food. BOY WE'RE WE WRONG. It just went downhill so fast. The chips and salsa were the highlight of the meal. First, we got seated eventually (maybe 15 min of confusion) and then our order was taken. We proceed to wait like you do at a restaurant. About 30 minutes later I asked for more chips and salsa the waitress took the basket and never came back with more. We watched another larger group table get seated and order. We watched them get their food. It had been an hour and we didn't have chips and salsa OR our orders! We got up to talk to someone only to have them tell us to sit down everyone is waiting it's a first in first out system. BS if this were True we would have had our food because our order was in before the others had even arrived to the restaurant! They proceeded to argue with us ending with it's "Mexican style" and to not expect service like anywhere else. Bull. So then they say fine your food is ready we'll give you a discount for this. So they took 50% off the bill. Our total was $30 and it wasn't even worth that. My shrimp fajitas came out on a cast iron skillet which was lukewarm (clearly just sitting out for a long time) and the rice with cheese ontop was so cold the rice was clumped and so was the cheese.  I've never been the type to be so upset to leave a review, but this is by far the worst dinning experience I've ever had. No exaggeration.  I hope no customer deals with these problems again.   TLDR: I would never go here again and would NEVER recommend it. Service horrible, waited 1+hr for food, and it was cold.

wbEz5wWn5Ua8ciGkuAKV_Q.text: We were very disappointed in the food at this supposedly authentic Mexican restaurant.  The food was very bland.  The guacamole tasted like it came from a processed food producer.  Rice and beans were ok but lukewarm.  Margarita was a bit on the sweet side.  Service was very good but would not go back due to the food.

giC614tC-EskHIo655oPJA.text: Not sure why there have been so many bad reviews lately. Just ate here this morning and had amazing food and service as I've always had. I'm in town on vacation and used to live in Scottsdale so I've eatin here well over 30 times. I've never had a bad meal and it's my go to restaurant when I come back. Maybe some bad reviews are good so there are shorter lines. It's always crazy busy.

br7f6SexRaQgZOvr7pTIng.text: Always make sure we stop at Frank and Lupe's when we are shopping in Old Scottsdale. Wonderful margaritas and the food is delicious. You can eat inside or out in the patio. Is you in the Old Scottsdale area you owe it to yourself to stop by.

GDTpu3ESdS3RrmkkDlo_Cg.text: Had a great time here super chill and casual atmosphere. The place takes you out of Arizona and right into old Mexico. The food was great tasted authentic. And the flan... hands down the best flan I've ever had and I've had many. Also shout out to Christie she was super friendly and very attentive

0pBQ1PyoRqRLPplhh7Pc5A.text: Pretty good. 3.5 to 4.0 stars. Fajitas were good.  They're generous on the portions. Service was quick.  An OK value.

5rW7br2HbqSFkJIy4p4ZQQ.text: Probably my favorite Mexican food place to eat in Scottsdale. I definitely recommend stopping by and trying it out!  They get pretty busy during lunch time so I'd suggest getting their early to grab a table. I'd recommend sitting in the back (if the weather is nice) where they outside seating. It's a little more spacious than the inside seating.   I've eaten here a few times with family and friends. The staff is attentive and accommodating. They serve chips and salsa for the table, the chips are great. The salsa is a little more blended than I'd prefer and not quite hot enough, but it's still good!   I've had their Chile relleno and their taco salad. Both were excellent and very rich in flavor. The food is reasonably priced for the area and the quality/quantity. I also tried their "beerita" which paired nicely with the meal.

jYHZCClJgRaAF0cn5WUPdw.text: Arrived at 5 and found many seats. Left at 6 and was full.  Margaritas were expensive. $16-$18 and were good, not great. So no value tonight. The bar bill (1 drink each) was more than our meal.  We both had chicken chimichangas which tasted like left over Christmas turkey. The tortilla wraps were burned on the outside and soggy inside.  The service was friendly but slow as we never had our water glasses refilled.  There are too many choices to do this again.

byACGvtlHZM0ZLLJfZRUCQ.text: Delicious food. I ordered the combo plate and everything on the plate was very tasty. The margaritas are good too. Service was friendly and quick.

4W-CAry434Rp1UCfC4-Qpw.text: My friends and I were told that the wait would be 25 minutes, which was fine.  We sat at the bar for 45 minutes and weren't offered a drink, chips and salsa, nothing.   The older man who was the host was more concerned with keeping me out of the servers way than helping us. When I asked about our 25 minute wait time after 45 minutes, he blew me off.   We ended up leaving and not spending a dime at this place.  I heard the food is good here, but I'll never know. I know the service was horrible and that's my first impression of this restaurant.

Y0pbU1cw0g3r_QKNHGiZNA.text: I love the food here! The blue corn flautas are fantastic!

qz3ZG_ubtNpBRs-R0PWyHw.text: This so far is my favorite Mexican restaurant in Scottsdale, however, I have only lived here for a couple of weeks. I am a big Mexican food lover, so this met my needs on many levels. The place is rather small, but it gives a more mom and pops, personal feel. The decor is Mexican which gives it a more authentic feel. I loved the salsa. It had a good garlic and spice combination. The food is rather cheap, but tasty. The service is very fast as well.   I have yet to try many other Mexican restaurants, but I feel this one will still rank high with me because of the taste, speed, price and casual atmosphere it brings.

mPiigRJzQa2RBpN_IG4JQQ.text: The food was pretty good, only small downside was the service, but that's probably because they were pretty steadily busy the entire time. The margaritas were delicious and strong. The dining area is on the small side but really gives the restaurant character. Overall a good experience and we'll be heading back there.

wvdZiFzDNzmSlxq7Q_WXYA.text: We came here a few years ago and it was decent and decided to go for dinner last night since it had been forever.  Won't be coming back - waiter did not come to the table for about 8 min, which was odd because the place was not packed yet.  We were hoping to get an order in before happy hour ended but no dice. Took drink orders, got drinks in a reasonable time, waiter came back in a decent amount of time to take orders.  Food arrived and the waiter walked away - they didn't come back to ask if we needed anything or whatnot, still, they weren't that busy.  Our drinks were empty and we really would have liked some water or another drink but no dice.  We ordered the chicken poblano enchiladas... there were maybe 5  chunks of chicken in mine and the chicken was super chewy/lumpy, like over cooked shrimp consistency, essentially we got cheese enchiladas covered in sauce.  Some random person brought water when we were finishing our food, the waiter grabbed our plates and brought the check.  All and all it wasn't a horrible experience but definitely won't be coming back or recommending.

_P03hwsj2J11lR22lHVybg.text: This the BEST Mexican food in town!   The food is a bit spicy but fantastic tasting.  The margarita's are the bomb!!  Great food!!  Easy on your pocket book!!

pu1jfNpHP2HRniFxPg5tvQ.text: Very good margaritas. Food came out very slow. 45 min for Mexican food? They had heat lamps on Patio but didn't put them on because of being out of propane...come on, run down the block for propane and get heat going for 30 customers outside.

e26EeDIuqCi1X1gbmLV9vw.text: I've been wanting to write this review for a long time. Every experience at Frank and Lupe's is pretty much the same so I think I can sum this up quickly.  Service: friendly but VERY SLOW, I wouldn't recommend coming here if you have somewhere to be after dinner. Slow to seat you, slow to serve you, slow to pick up your check.  Food: I love the chips and salsa. The mole here is incredible!! The shrimp fajitas are good too, but inconsistent. And, I had a bite of my friends poblano cream chicken enchiladas -- the sauce was delicious but the chicken was bland. If you are looking for a good taco plate or enchilada with rice and beans...move along because the rest of the menu is bland-to-mediocre at very best. The last time I was there the beans were undercooked and the rice was flavorless. MOLE OR BUST! It might be the only thing worth coming for.   Summary: The mole alone would get 5 stars but I realize it's not for everyone. Thumbs down for the service and the remainder of the menu (for the most part).

vuaLWNLAQhvopFhuZBD4ew.text: Really, cockroaches trying to get into our food and the manager doesn't care???   We left cash to cover what we ate and drank, minus what the cockroaches wanted, but got a "you have a problem??"   Omg. Do not go here

-iKb5_GweWPM-m8WpDoweg.text: The only reason I gave this any star is because I had to, I havent ate here in quite awhile and now I remembered why!!  We took my twin Grand babies here for lunch , babys get cranky when they are hungry so usually waiters try and bring something to nibble on.. the service was terrible had to ask several times for chips and they ended up coming out with the food after 20 mins..when the food arrived it was cold and soggy with extra hot sause just poured haphazardly over the food (just terrible) when I told my waitress about the food being cold she said 'oh gesh' take care not to enter this terrible place..there so many great places in the old town scottsdale area that care about what they serve their customers and care about good service...

iK8xZ-VXbvUlRfOjlxakiw.text: My experience was a mix of what others have said. I went at around 0730 and there were several open tables, I was greeted quickly and seated. The service was fast and friendly, I ordered the combo plate and was surprised how quickly it came out. Unfortunately the food itself wasn't very good. The taco's ground beef was too salty (and I generally like salty), the rest of the food was fairly bland and only luke warm to boot- the plate was hot, just not the food on it. After the food was delivered the service also disappeared, no refills or offers the entire time there. Food- 2 stars Service- 4 when seated, 1 after- so strange Atmosphere- 3 stars Value- 2 stars

IKJq6o6micJvrFTodDx-2w.text: I make sure to eat here every time I'm in Scottsdale for work. Anything with the shredded beef is my go-to dish. Service is great!

FORkihMGUr9AN7cUH9yE1g.text: Love this.place. Real down to earth good food. Felt transported to Mexico. Nice friendly service. DEFINTE,recommend

DsptfJ0tqUQd3iwLtpBc2g.text: We walked in and it was super busy, but snagged two seats at the bar right away. Chips and salsa were placed in front of us fairly quickly and they were delicious. It took about ten minutes for someone to take our drink (which included an apology). I ordered the patron mojito because the menu specified fresh ingredients (agave nectar, lime, seltzer water), but as I watched him make it, it was mixed with a pre-mixed mojito blend. It tasted like a watered down margarita, but after I asked for soda water to be added, it tasted a little better. I wouldn't have ordered the drink had I known it would have been prepared that way so that was a bummer. We ordered the carnitas platter and blue corn tortilla tacos. The food came out quickly and tasted pretty good. Although, the carnitas platter came with flour tortillas. It bugs me when a restaurant assumes my tortilla choice. I thought it came with corn considering most restaurants in the area serve corn unless specified. I would have asked for corn as a replacement, but the staff was hustling for the rest of the restaurant and not really paying great attention to bar customers. We got our check and then they took my credit card and didn't give it back. After about ten mins, I had to ask for it. It was sitting in an open book in a pile of other empty ticket books. We will probably go back because the food was awesome. However, we will likely get it to go because quality of drinks and service left something to be desired. At least they were polite during the limited interactions!

miplOmwthVbDNG9y78AUzA.text: The food is exquisite. The Pablano Enchiladas are worth the time.  The only reason its not 5-stars is because the waiter was terse and impatient. However, the bus boy was really great!

hdRU3nccB9caxqihKpDQGw.text: The service was slow. Although the food was good they were missing items they said it would come with. I had to send my margarita back twice because it was to sweet and they never brought my chips and salsa that I asked for.

4WduSsIKf4PVQNXQI1rv7w.text: The best Mexican food in town , they have the best and the most cleanest Mexican restaurant that I have ever seen , the food was amazing and delicious , the price was affordable and indeed this is the best

XtcvbmXe-Ln-cva3QI1Tbw.text: My birthday dinner was pretty much dissed by the servers here. I made reservations a week before but most everything was messed up and they didn't care. They had one server for THE WHOLE PATIO. We even had to ask for menus, waters, and chips since we weren't talked to until 20 mins after getting there. Half of the group didn't get their food and mine came out cold. The only thing that they did right was give me a birthday shot and I can't resist their Mole sauce (reason for the extra star). We were stuck there for over 3 1/2 hours due to the lack of good service. Go here if you have nothing else to do during the night since the servers do not care about you or your time at all.

0wjrQlfiUNMUK5Zp7TByyQ.text: We went back to Frank & Lupe's after sampling their stuffed sopapilla on an Old Town Scottsdale food tour.   First off, chips were freshly fried and not greasy. The salsa was good too. For lunch, I ordered the chicken flautas lunch with rice and beans. It was very flavorful with a kick. I had no idea it was going to be spicy at all, but I like spice, so it was fine with me!   For dessert, we decided on the sopapillas which were served with honey. The sopapillas were light and fluffy and not at all greasy. Add some honey, and it was a perfect ending to a good Mexican lunch.

QsbI2yYu-wOiPADlXjl1Yw.text: Offset from the typical path, was recommended to us. Good chips and salsa! Order the stuffed sopapilla! It was great! Spicy pork really had a kick to it and the beans and rice were well flavored. If I was a local it would be a regular spot!

JXNrwxVhrbPu-uTAGHr8lg.text: The food was pretty darn excellent. I got the smothered burrito and i couldn't have wanted anything more. The Margarita even somehow made me happier than most margaritas. But, the real gem was the atmosphere. The patio was awesome, and the decorations were about as authentic as you can get. The service was fast, friendly, and our servwr ended up chatting with us for a bit. I'd definitely love to go back.

wYODPTYWD43je2mi6YLjkA.text: Quaint little Mexican restaurant in old town near fashion square. Cute courtyard with amazing authentic food. Great New Mexican red and green sauces. Perfect ending to a perfect weekend.

photos.caption: Photo of Frank & Lupe's Old Mexico - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Delicious and spicy pork with adodabo sauce
Photo of Frank & Lupe's Old Mexico - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Stacked chicken enchiladas topped with egg and green sauce
Photo of Frank & Lupe's Old Mexico - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Amazing lunch at authentic Frank and Lupe&#39;s Mexican restaurant

xrY3UN3FIwHPQMY4wtkkIw.text: If only they would make fresh sour, the margaritas would be awesome. The food is good but the meats are heavily seasoned. Had the fajita burrito, and without all the fixins would have been too seasoned. Not amazing but would give it another shot

fKjr4E2oirmmwBJylkW9Iw.text: Lame!  Walked in at 9:15pm on a Wednesday. They say they close at 10pm on their hours.  2 Other people were sitting at tables waiting for food. They turned me and my wife away saying they were closed. I don't like lazy people or places. Not when it involves my food.

NaCKmKPoChRgdNbJrvWI7w.text: We had a party of four seeking dinner after trade show  - three were very into Mexican food and I was meh because usually I get bad tummy fluctuation reactions after eating it. We found this place on Yelp, and decided to give it a try. What a pleasant surprise! It looked small but inside it's got a yard and wonderful patio settings. Food was great, the three Mexican food enthusiasts ordered various enchilada, I orders beef fajitas. Wonderful wonderful. They had no food left on their plates, I ate almost all of mine too (size is really more than I could stuff in). We walked away happily full. And the three are already planning on the next trip's coming back to this place. And I was super happy this wonderful meal did not give me tummy aches at all. Yum!

photos.caption: Photo of Frank & Lupe's Old Mexico - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

Ut1Z1Fn3p00TJcGf_G5_VA.text: This was a busy night in Old Town. We were really looking for an affordable steak. We chose to enjoy the warm weather and eat in their patio area. We grabbed a drink at the bar but were disappointed that they didn't have any Negra Modelo on hand. The staff was friendly, but didn't see very organized or informed. The host kept telling us that he just put people at tables. After a bit of a wait, we were given a table. After a few minutes, the host requested that we re-position our table to accommodate a group of 17. We then watched as they went through heroic efforts to move tables and change all the chairs. After awhile this plan was abandoned and the party was moved to another room. In the meantime, we read the menu and noticed they didn't have steaks. Steaks were clearly mentioned on their website. At this point we just gave up. We finally had a table and didn't want to go somewhere else and start over again. This was the only dinner we were having in Scottsdale. We ordered a chicken soup and steak fajitas. Both were delicious, especially the soup which came in a generous bowl and was large enough to consider it a meal. The fajitas were good, but no substitute for what we had been craving.

4mUF4fvuSphSNp7NUxn_Tw.text: Good service for 3:30pm, caprese appetizer delicious. Fish tacos tasty but taco shells became soggy a bit quickly. Delicious margarita. Great value for money.

mZ91VtWjwilxDp7Hpd-Ibg.text: Horrible.  Ordered chicken fajitas and tamales plate to go.  Food was cold. We don't get tortillas for the fajitas. Everything looked like it was thrown together.   Very disappointed.   $27.00 wasted.

photos.caption: Photo of Frank & Lupe's Old Mexico - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Frank & Lupe's Old Mexico - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

UC_UmqrKe-15x3uERxrIOQ.text: Maybe I came on a bad night. Started with a mojito variation made with tequila. It tasted like a severely watered down margarita. For dinner I had the carnitas platter. The carnitas were very bland and tasted like they had freezer burn. Service was average but could not make up for the poor food and drink.   Great location but it seemed to me that the passion of the chef, bartender, and owners left this place some time ago. Hopefully they can get that back and ensure that every dish and drink that they send out is the best and freshest it can be.

i6NY5epKnsqSpezft8Qvrw.text: This is the absolutely best New Mexican food in the area! Growing up in New Mexico, Frank and Lupes knows how to make fresh red chili and green Hatch chili is all they use.. The best!!!

Meuw-K2J6wdybBcpXHSdLg.text: Another night in Scottsdale, another solid Mexican restaurant.  After a nice walk through some of old town, I ended up a F&L's, on the back patio.  The night was cool, but not cold, perfect for enjoying some food and spirits.  The bartender, Julie I think, was very attentive.  Chip and salsa appeared out of no where and were good.  A large margarita was a bit on the sweeter side, but still very tasty.  I ordered a chicken burrito, a la carte (like the previous night) and it was good....but I did need to ask for some sour cream and guacamole.    It was a quiet night, so I had some good bartender conversation and actually met the owners son who was very night as well.  I definitely recommend.

MAEwFnPkhfefiLquadnKZg.text: Great old town hideaway.  Killer margaritas, friendly service,  and well done cuisine.

6nCDTtaTNPHw4HLQM83Jtw.text: This is such a cool spot in Old Town Scottsdale if you are in the mood for Mexican. Small dining room separate from bar area allows for good authentic atmosphere and doesn't have the hectic/chain restaurant feel. The food was very good quality, I got the shrimp fajitas Cancun and it was great and very filling. We came in right before close and they worked hard to give us the same experience we would've had earlier. Great authentic Mexican place!

QSHcCq6znM-5cfuyILnU2A.text: I would give this place 0 stars if I could. I was with three HUNGRY kids, looking for a decent meal (we had a good meal here 1 year ago). As we first walked in, they said they would have a table ready for us in 5 minutes. We waited politely for at least 25 minutes before I went in to check on our table. I was then told it would be 15 more minutes. I was completely outraged and asked why they told us 5 minutes. I got no explanation and we left absolutely furious, with empty stomachs. We will never go back to this restaurant!

_Aaag8lMX3FoiaQXCqz2vQ.text: Best Mexican in Scottsdale.  I've been to every MX restaurant in Scottsdale and this one is the consistent winner in terms of food ambiance and service.  Best fajitas in town and better priced than most other places.  happy hour is also a great time here.

UK3GvnIGrzAjeZeSRUb8Xw.text: We had a great lunch here on the patio. I highly recommend the mole chicken enchiladas and margarita. The mole sauce is homemade and exceptional.

wVphhYHaDZzODedC6QA8pg.text: Worst place ever they always say they don't have something so they don't have to cook it for you becquse their closing they also close at 10 i was there at 8...and they closed early one night just cuz... Why have hours?this happens all the time I'm done

FcIhR7ssd9dV6g5CVkUg7A.text: Amazing food, warm accommodating atmosphere and did I mention the food? We came here as a big group of nine (including a picky seven year old) and had an amazing lunch. As the lone vegetarian I got the 'El Flaco' which was some kind of veggie burrito with beans. Now normally these veggie burritos are just rice and beans but this one had all kinds of delicious veggies in there and the sauce was just the perfect mix of spices. I surveyed the group and every one of us had a great meal.   Oh, and that picky seven year old ended up devouring some churros and sopapillos =)

photos.caption: Photo of Frank & Lupe's Old Mexico - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. El Flaco burrito meal

cPEfHl0HXE3riAFJnLopCA.text: Returned with the same out of town guests.  It seemed like something was off with this place.  The food was OK but the service was just so-so.   Waiter Wasn't actually rude but just totally unfriendly.  Seemed like he didn't want to be there.  .  Very negative vibes.   I'm not a paranoid person, The first time we loved it   Maybe there was a change in management or something.  It's a cute place though

q09Dby2tB0EY3SKkr0gXww.text: Nice restaurant with easy going atmosphere. We found waiter to be a bit abrupt plus both meals arrived with knife laying across the food - not very hygienic. A shame as place seems good with good food.

EDvRGkmsjzrRAIDA1IRzZA.text: This place has authentric Mexican food, great service and a wonderful atmosphere.  Fair prices and good drinks complete the deal.

photos.caption: Photo of Frank & Lupe's Old Mexico - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Frank & Lupe's Old Mexico - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

Tczp4EV4ZiFduj2Bq4hS0Q.text: The only nice thing is the patio. Staff unfriendly, food terrible. Probably the worst Mexican food I have ever had. Maybe if we had been drinking it would have tasted better.

j5obB-LJOg8mcHpG7Xw3Nw.text: Great place for authentic Mexican food. Outdoor dining makes for fun atmosphere. Love the fresh salsa. Recommend the chicken fajitas. Tastes homemade not like chain food places.  Only odd thing was Chile relleno with no sauce. Will definitely return when in scottsdale.

d_Z63gpnvxT_YgK0tV-AJw.text: This was my first time coming to Frank and Lupe's.  We were a part of a big birthday party about 15 of us.  We sat on the patio, it was a beautiful night to do so.  The menu was huge. I had the chicken chimi (ever known me to turn down a chimi?) which was huge had to take the leftovers home.  I wish I had room left to get my favorite dessert, sopapillas!  Someone at our table ordered it, it looked great.  I thought the food was good, reasonably priced and thought the margaritas were great.  The parking is horrible for going on a Friday or Saturday, wish the parking lot was for F & L customers only. I had to drive around and found one parking space over by Herb Box, that's too far away. Fortunately, a friend called me and said there was one space open.  I would not recommend going to this place with a big party.  About 4 of the people in our party didn't get their food.  They got their drinks and I thought the server should have given them something to eat to soak up all the drinks they had.  Not sure if they had drinks before but they seemed like they had been over served.  I would go back but not with a big group.

YU59dW9nI6xUwB18F6n1WQ.text: Stopped for lunch on New Year's Eve. Food was greasy and didn't have a lot of flavor. We love Mexican food but didn't really enjoy this place.

qK3zkQJwWly3ypD699awwg.text: The food tries to be authentic Mexican but falls bland in flavor.  Very average Mexican food.

af3VKQNe-eTxa1voCS-DGQ.text: Never returning again. The service was slow, the food wasn't hot, the drinks seemed watered down. Their food wasn't at all tasty. It seemed as though they didn't marinate their flavors together when it came to food. The place is cute, but the lack of attention from their staff, the subpar drinks and the tasteless food will not make me a regular. I put full bar as an option when prompted but they really don't have a full bar since they only have a few top shelf choices.

Sa5oS4FouRpNXnsjBg4ixg.text: The interesting things about Frank & Lupe's are the name and the decor but other than that nothing else really stood out. Oh except for the chips, great chips, but a restaurant can not only be about chips. The food was mediocre I didn't even finish my enchiladas which is rare for me didn't find it was worth the calories. Might be a cool place for just drinks and app's but certainly not dinner.

o2IC0d0HiOrjrcQqQzzEOA.text: Food does not make up for slow and poor service. Chips/ salsa were average

b2joqnqCTxhablkEriTs3A.text: Excellent experience! Fish tacos out of this world and lupe's enchiladas also superb.

qT-pGvexMuLU_80MQt6_Gw.text: Very cute place with a great patio, but be warned that the food is really spicy! I enjoy hot food but this was borderline unedible. Margaritas were good and decor is fun and festive. Service was great and exchanged my extra spicy food without issue.

MkUaB-Q2H_W0vUPOfXgvBQ.text: In an expensive chi-chi district but has that neighborhood family restaurant feel. The casual outdoor seating with misters makes for a pleasant evening. Great big margaritas. Good service and nobody rushes you  Food is midrange ok, somewhat Americanized & not very spicy but solid selection.

photos.caption: Photo of Frank & Lupe's Old Mexico - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Chicken enchiladas mole
Photo of Frank & Lupe's Old Mexico - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Outdoor dining area
Photo of Frank & Lupe's Old Mexico - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Outdoor bar

BCIQGEj-fCmzHYoA-9f8KQ.text: Service is slow but worth the wait. Tried everything from Quesadilla (An authentic version with beans and cheese) to fajitas (also authentic with spicy red sauce) to Huevos Rancheros (Oh so heavenly) and Open faced cheese enchiladas. This is where I stop.  Open face cheese enchiladas came with eggs, and a variety of sides.  Have you ever heard a song that gave you the shivers? It was kind of like that. I took one bit of my concoction (I put the egg wrapped in the enchilada, beans, rice, salsa, sour cream?)  And my mind exploded. It was the MOST heavenly thing I have EVER tasted.  Ever. However, I have not gone back and ordered it again becuase.. I dont want to ruin the memory. Of this perfect moment in culinary heaven. I dont want to over-eat it. It was... so.. delicious. And I had their sopapillas which come with meals with some beans and cheese in it after, which was a fine closure to the worlds perfect meal.  Service is always slow here, just like in Mexico ;D but all of the food is fresh and worth the wait. Chips and salsa are 'alright'.

cNcd90LUrM1dtcWIJ6vMBw.text: First time at Frank & Lupes in old town Scottsdale, heard this place can make a mean margarita, but I did not see any being made tonight....to say the least I was sort of stuck here, due to some prick of a cop....but that's another story.  Walked into this place and it was quite busy, was actually quite surprised on how busy it was for 7pm on a Weds night. Lots of College football fans in their gear due to the game between the ducks and Auburn the day before, so I am assuming most of them were tourist.  There was no hostess, and after looking around I decided to mosey up to an empty stool at the bar, took the bartender/waiter a minute to see me, but once he did he was on top of things.   Got a Corona and my chip and salsa on, not a big fan of the authentic chips, and the salsa was a bit watery, I got an extra side of sour cream and guacamole, the guacamole was good, large chunks of avocado in it. Sour cream was your run of the mill, after looking over the unimpressive and hard to read lettering on the menu...due to poor design.  I decided after the chips maybe just to stick with what I had, so I got the nacho supreme with chicken. To say the least I was not impresses with any part of this dish except for the fact that it was huge...and the chicken was good...but there was not enough of it.   Total tab came to almost $25.00 for one beer and nacho supreme and a little extra sour cream and guacamole...RIP OFF!!!  Could of got better nacho's at Filberto's in Phoenix for way cheaper.  I would be willing to give this place another shot but to say the least I was not very impressed with it on this visit due to the lackluster food and high prices!

6mtOdgcxd_YlmgmW7TFUzA.text: Love this place for Mexican food and margaritas.  My fave is their fish tacos, but all their food is good.  Prefer their outdoor patio area to the inside restaurant.

QfCAz2RJfTTDnDkvPY_gpQ.text: Terribleeee management!!! obviously nobody is there to take care of this place. The poor servive and customer care is depressing. When I asked to talk to the manager to complain about my food being cold and taking too long, they replied with "sorry but the manager is not here", come on!  Food was alright, but definately not the best. Clearly, the staff does what they want, no coordination at all, they didnt have a hostess to take care and pace the customers waiting. Place is so tiny you are almost eating together with the table next to you. Did I say terrible management???

qiURUIqjd3qMmfo2mMUz5g.text: Hits the spot as an old school mexican joint.  Check out the back patio.  Chips and salsa, margs, and Frank or Lupe Enchilada plates are solid.  Perfect place for the laid back restaurant goer.

TgCNq7ywroFFYydn9PU9KQ.text: Chips & salsa are delicious, e quality of food has gone down here over the past few years.  It's quick cheap Mexican food. Enjoy

htO1UkmEz92U5p-5Ahe-8w.text: This is one of my favorite Mexican restaurants and miss it dearly.   When we lived in Scottsdale, we would go there at least once a week. The food is excellent, a quite location.   My favorite are the sopapillas! They are a pillow of goodness that only gets better with honey.

PoPRnfog4b7sfMf-Rr9HXA.text: grab a nice cold margarita on one of the hippest hidden patios around.  Frank and Lupe's has been serving up some of the best Mexican food in a town overflowing with Mexican restaurants for over 25 years now. Located on the corner of Marshall Way and Indian School, Frank and Lupe's features authentic Mexican dishes such as Carne Adobada, Shrimp Enchiladas or Chili Relleno.  But the real treat awaits out back.  For those of you who know about the back patio (or discovered it on accident while searching for the bathrooms) we don't need to say anything else. For the rest of you, skip the small restaurant up front and head in back for one of the best outdoor experiences around.  I love to grab the Chicken Mole Enchiladas (fabulous) with a ginormous  (yes it is in the Webster dictionary now) margarita on the rocks and enjoy the great weather Scottsdale has to offer. The back patio is hidden from the traffic and pedestrians of Marshall way and offers a south of the border feeling when you want a little retreat.  What better place to enjoy a time out!  Need a real treat? Skip the Sopaipillas and try a Xango. What is a Xango you ask? A deep fried cheesecake rolled in a flour tortilla!

mqQGPxIPDriIgpXdjn7r9A.text: Solid food!!  Best Mexican food I've had in a while - and it is my favorite type of food!  This has more of a New Mexico flare with just the right amount of spice and flavor in everything.  The salsa was very fresh and tasty, the main course was very filling and exploding with flavor, and to end it all were some delicious homemade sopapillas (which were included with our meal)!!  Service was great, kids meal choices were terrific for my 3 year old and price was right on!!  I will be back for sure.

MTa4XAw4muvwR4FokblfSQ.text: I ordered the spicy shrimp whichis noted as very spicy.  It was so NOT spicy and NOT flavorful.  However I had a nice time inspite of the food.....

hlVoDAdTZLcUpRadPb0JBw.text: The service was horrible, the  food was mediocre.  For a restaurant located in Old Scottsdale I would expect better.  I arrived for my reservations at 6:30 and was told to go to the patio area and seat myself.  Once seated I sat for more than an half an hour before a server asked to take my drink order and I did not see the server again for another 45 minutes.  By the time my order did arrive I had been at the restaurant for almost 2 hours.  I ordered shrimp fajitas and there were no tortillas included!  I had to ask for tortillas, that should come with fajitas, and they took another 10 minutes to arrive.  By the time the tortillas arrived, my food was cold.  Then getting my bill proved just as great of a challenge and after waiting another 30 minutes I had to go to the bar to pay my restaurant bill.  Total time at the restaurant?  Right around 3 hours.  Frank and Lupe's was recommended by my hotel.  When I got back I was sure to let the hotel manager know what a nightmare Frank and Lupe's was and how dining there hijacked my whole evening.  DO NOT GO TO FRANK AND LUPE'S!!!!!!!

ySlu32wOQ8C8Bsnc8s7zcw.text: Food was good. Slow service. First time that I've had to walk outside through a parking lot to get to the bathroom.

w6Eq3rvdj2u8P1uKpcaxVg.text: My family ate at Frank & Lupe's this past week and we were NOT impressed. Although the meals themselves are reasonably priced they charge for refills of chips and salsa, really? Unfortunately the food was not that great and we will not return for that reason. The staff were extremely nice, too bad they work for Frank & Lupe's!

v4HlJMnzI8QYXR--ffaM-Q.text: Good food.  Horrid service. I have been to Frank and Lupe's a good half dozen times. I always enjoy my meal, but a majority of the wait staff leaves something to be desired. Did you order a beer? Good luck getting it in under 5 minutes. Did you ask for guacamole with those chips and salsa? Well, it just conveniently wasn't brought to the table even though you asked twice and got an "okay" from your server. So, go for the food. Be prepared to wait and be proactive if you need something.

ZHHDD3EZ4koV8iKUv6GHAg.text: I wrote this whole big review of Frank & Lupe's, but then my internet connection died.  Let's just say that this place reminds me of the taquerias you find on just about every block in Chicago -- great food, cheap prices and lousy service. I had the chicken enchiladas mole and they were yummy.  The rice and beans were also a cut above average, and the chips were fresh, light and flaky. The sopapillas that finished the meals were not too sweet, so you can add honey to your taste.  Liked this place a lot and would definitely go back.

cjAV2d6Kd239oU5UnIEBIw.text: There is a problem in the kitchen, the kitchen had a fire...not exactly sure what we heard, but hey, the food was good, so...  We both ordered the Carne Asada Burrito, Beans, and Rice special.  I loved the flavor of the rice, and the beans were pretty decent too.  The burrito, though it looked fairly plain, actually had very good flavor.  The chips and salsa at the beginning were tasty as well, although I have to admit, the taste of the chips far out did the taste of the salsa.  The only "complaint", and not really a complaint, was the service was kind of lacking in refilling drinks, etc...  otherwise, I thought, very worth the money spent.

uZXFzbSmGrEaGcfWdtQvLA.text: Like the quaint atmosphere really cute!  Out door seating that is nice during the cooler times of year.  I eat here often and everything is a hit!  If you just want some tacos theirs are an A plus...the meat juicy and tender in the chicken tacos and the chili relleno  is the best around.  The chips are so fresh...and the salsa is spicy but not too hot.  A nice place for a date ...have a margarita, enjoy a great dinner and then walk around the galleries...a night to remember!

WBrEsxdEjIjrBXvHtMpYgg.text: Good atmosphere if you want to get away from the tourist type of restaurant. Salsa and chips are ok. Got the special guacamole dip - pretty good. Had the Enchiladas del Mar - was ok. Service could have been better. Sopapillas were average - fried bread and you add your own honey.

iLjPqfimMQ47_8cZQJTI8A.text: We tried this place on a recommendation by a friend. I've lived in Arizona for about 10 years and this is definetely in my top 5 Mexican food places! I had the shredded beef tacos and let me tell you they were the best I ever had and that is saying alot because I have had alot of shredded beef tacos! The outside patio was awesome! The only downside was the crappy chips and salsa. The salsa was the runniest I have ever has. It is very decently priced, we had two entrees and two beers and it was only about $24!  Even if you dont live near oldtown you should make the trip to this place! I give it a "Hot damn! That was some tasty food!"

2jfDcUDi6gDdVb86ONn7Lg.text: While in Scottsdale for the first time today I consulted Yelp for a recommendation on an inexpensive spot for lunch. Frank & Lupe's popped up with three stars and since we wanted Mexican we thought we'd give it a try. What an unexpected surprise since three stars did not do this place justice. The service was friendly and prompt, Miranda was our server. The chips and salsa were excellent. My margarita was perfect, and the chile relleno was yummy and authentic. My friend had the huevos rancheros and said it was as good as "grandma makes". Ask for a side of poblano sauce, it's wonderful on everything they serve. This is definitely a great Scottsdale restaurant.

pARYb3ugXxsZKjdFsH3t9w.text: I've eaten at this small mexican diner a bunch and really like it- a litle inconsistent, but that goes with the territory.  My measure of a mex place is can they make a good Releno- and these guys get it done.  Have you ever noticed- everything is better sitting at the bar and conversing with the people cooking and waiting on you??  They tend to take better care with you.

p6B3CsaQKaXZVy2G2QhiPA.text: Why five stars? Because the poblano enchiladas will make you believe in God! God is a Mexican from Puebla because he put so much love into these chiles!! And frank and lupes crafted them into these glorious enchiladas.

KmWp9SERhJzD0urenbNGVw.text: Reviews of this place are all over the board, but I always eat there when I do my yearly Scottsdale gallery crawl. The food and ambience, a series of indoor and outdoor patio rooms, are quaint and very satisfying, with good size portions, and a very friendly staff. At least to me they are. I was last there in late November and had the days special, enchiladas in a poblano sauce which was quite good. The salsa is spiced just right.

-TiIWJTkl72wxJI2pD2HnA.text: Gorgeous day on Monday and nothing cures my hangover like Mexican beer. Husband and I headed over to Frank and Lupe's to sit on the patio and enjoy the sun. Their complimentary chips are delicious and they don't give too large a portion, so as to avoid not having room for the main dish. Little bit of a pet peeve is having chips down before the water, but drinks were quickly delivered following the drop. The waitress was terribly slow, but it was obvious she was busy and not neglectful. It did not affect service. Why? Sometime you realize the True hero of restaurants is the back server (aka the busboy). The back server took our drink orders and made sure we were o.k. whenever the waitress was not around (which was pretty often).  I ordered the fish tacos and husband ordered the chimichanga. He was a huge fan of the meat, believing it to be of a higher quality than others he had at Mexican food restaurants. My fish tacos were delicious and gone in about two minutes. It was good to be reminded that this gem is close to home and should be added to the dining out rotation.

6iSZBvZfO28fvffCur2crA.text: My girlfriend and my buddy from out of town went here on a Saturday night.  The place wasn't packed and had a good atmosphere about it.  Not too hectic, nice and laid back.    Unfortunately we had to wait 40 mnutes for our food to arrive, which was as a complete mystery since the place wasn't packed and during that time we barely had a visit from our waitress.  The chips and salsa were good, the sopaipillas with honey are absolutely delicious.  I had the chicken taquitos which were fine, a little dried out but fine.  My buddy had Lupe's Enchiladas and he says they were fine but he's had better.  The service is what really ruined it for us.  I imagine others could have a different experience, but when you see waitresses outside on their cell phones you can understand they may have other priorities than waiting on your table.

5g848_PM-J8_jxD8UZrpAQ.text: The first time I was invited to Frank & Lupe's with some friends, it was a last-minute invitation and subsequently I was unable to arrive exactly at the time of their reservation. I was literally on my way! The restaurant didn't care - they have a policy that refuses to seat incomplete parties. On a subsequent visit, I realized why (and I definitely don't hold a grudge about my first experience). This place is popular, and always seems to have a long waiting list. I'd be upset if they sat incomplete parties in front of me too. I can't be a hypocrite! Pitchers of margaritas, average chips/salsa, and impressive dinner combination platters. I've only sat on the patio, and I never intend to sit inside. One of the main reasons I enjoy F&L's is the atmosphere of that patio. It truly is secluded and you can easily forget you are in Scottsdale. If you are a fan of Mexican food/atmosphere, you'll love this spot. Skip the chains like Macayo's - and head straight to Frank & Lupe's... Just make sure you have a complete party!

1VAMgzRSL9VflKbNOpuKIQ.text: Had lunch at Frank and Lupe's today.  Great New  Mexican food.  I had a taco salad which was terrific, other had a burrito, and taco's along with rice and beans.  Everyone enjoyed their meals.

0W_XeyriAmEv8RKMO34sRw.text: I realize that management is trying to keep the place as authentic as possible, there is a recurring theme in these reviews and eventually people will stop coming here, you have a great location and once upon a time an amazing restaurant.  The service and attitude of ALL staff is shocking, from the minute you arrive you feel like you are inconveniencing them.  You have a busy restauarant, if you do not have the kitchen capacity, do something about it, when you have a family with a baby, I would have preferred you told me to leave rather than seating me and making us wait for an hour for our food. And when it arrives you mess up the order and tell us that we can either eat what you put in front of us or wait another 20 minutes for the food we ordered.  And to top it off the food was cold, meat overcooked...absolute garbage. Is there any management on staff?  I never saw one and if there are they don't give a crap about their customers.

OsGVN7sG6QNNBgadaf6Msg.text: I have been here numerous times... love the food and the margaritas.  The service sometimes is excellent and other times it is not so good.  I do however always come back so I guess I take my chances in order to enjoy their food.  I love the spinach cheese crisp and the rolled enchilada's plate.  Their chips and salsa are awesome!

dTELn3WzKYnH5btky87OdQ.text: 12/10 reccomend! Frank & Lupes is a great family owned business that is dedicated to providing you with amazing authentic New Mexican food! This place is a great restaurant to come to and relax and enjoy your night with some buddies! I will be back her again! Great service, amazing food, and delicious drinks!

lw9fP1I3cO-PuzooGsFZWQ.text: Been here multiple times, three to be exact (tried to check in during my second visit but Yelp was down).   My first visit was awesome, the service was great and the food was solid. This visit I would've given 4 stars given the service, food and overall vibe of the place.  During my second visit, the service was absolutely awful. Our server was rude, hardly came to our table and it seemed like we were burdening him with our presence. It didn't help matters that our host put us at a table for 2 people when we had 3 people in our party, so our table was not adequately sized to have our entrees on it. This visit I chalked up as an anomaly.  My third visit, again with a party of 3, we sat on the patio. There were three servers on the patio and 2 parties totaling 5 people. Our server is candidate for one of the worst servers I've ever had. She was rude, again we felt like a burden to her and she spent more time flirting with her colleague than actually coming to our table. A meal that should've taken 35 minutes took 75 minutes. Getting our check was even painstaking.  Needless to say that based on 2 out of 3 of my visits to Frank & Lupe's I give up on it. The food is okay but not worth the price of admission and the lackluster service that seems to be commonplace.

N6oQiXwklrD5kzY1GnBLnA.text: Great atmosphere and pretty good food but kinda pricey!   Small free chips and salsa but then charged for extras!   Margarita was bottled...expected more from this establishment!  Loved the patio!

1N-7zMqq9uxbNOgH0AMRoQ.text: Just visiting old town Scottsdale for the day and we saw this place as we were parking. Figured we stop for lunch before we shop. Walked around the back to the patio and the waitress seated us right away.   She took our drink orders quickly and asked if we were ready to order. I asked for the two taco plate, shredded beef. She told me they don't have shredded beef. I pointed it out on the menu that it says they do and she explained that they just didn't have any today. I understood and asked if she would come back so i could rethink my dish.  A few minutes later she returned, my husband ordered enchiladas with mole and I ordered the corn tamales and asked for a side of sour cream, she told me they don't have sour cream. That kind of ended it for me there, because I hate going out to eat where they don't have anything you ask for, but we stuck it out. It didn't take long for our food to arrive, rice and beans aren't anything special, but the corn tamales were delicious and i tried my husbands enchiladas and chicken mole and that was amazing.  I guess I can say we probably won't seek out this place to eat here again when we come back to Scottsdale, but I do know where I can get some good corn tamales and chicken mole.

Ad6AV1ANj1WiwX1HD93lug.text: When you show up at 9pm on Saturday on Memorial Weekend and their website and yelp say they are open until 10pm but management tells you they have decided to close early. Really misleading and disappointing when they claim to be a great Mexican food product in old town.

Awhje4WgoWreiPHMGmJW6g.text: By far the best Mexican restaurant I've been to since I've moved to Arizona. The food is absolutely delicious and the atmosphere could not be better.   Thank you so much for being so awesome  Your happy customer  Gary Van Derveer

4OLxMMMjGntL28Gp_nGmrQ.text: If you are craving northern style "New Mexico" Mexican food complete with authentic fire-roasted green chile and real red chile enchiladas, then look no further.  Rumor has it the original restaurant is located in Socorro, NM. It doesn't get any more authentic than this - including Hatch chilies and incredible salsa.  Yes, the cuisine is definitely "warm to hot" and spicy,  so if you can't take the heat, you can always fall back to "gringo" food.  I highly recommend the flat red enchiladas or the carne avocado.  Frank and Lupe's is an incredible gastronomic oasis in a vast desert of mediocre wanna-be Taco Bell look-a-like Mexican restaurant's.

6Y0VggVFyF1X3Lnft2oF3w.text: Food still good. Had the Lupes enchiladas. Good texture of tortillas....not too thick not too thin. The beans were creamy and the rice is always well seasoned. Sopapilllas were super hot and flaky....always great doused in honey. Service tonight was so awful.  "how many in your party? Four? Ok follow me". Then sits us at a two top. But then seats us somewhere more appropriate after we say again...4. No water. Margarita with salt was brought out without salt. Wife's cocktail had agave syrup which she asked to not have. Then the other part of the drinks...she originally wanted one of their cocktails that had mint...but they were out of mint. My buddy wanted a Tecate or Tecate light. But no, they were out of that too.  She brings us our check but my dish came with sopapillas so I had to ask for them. And to top it all off, she just really acted like we were asking too much of her to do her job.  We're frequent diners of Frank and Lupes. Hopefully this was just a one time thing.

DOTTkYBtBNSDsWhngEazkA.text: Stopped in here while I was traveling for work.   They have indoor and outdoor seating. I love the authentic decor. I'll be back!  The chips and salsa were great. Chips were fresh and the salsa had an adobo taste.

photos.caption: Photo of Frank & Lupe's Old Mexico - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. #8-weird knife placement, right?

_41QAK8Yp9P8DBqrLveXog.text: I don't know what I was thinking when I came to this restaurant, I should've checked the reviews before I walked in.  It wasn't planned at all. I was in the area and hungry, so I thought I would grab some quick Mexican food, but I was wrong.  Service was ok, the food wasn't good at all-so I ate quarter of it. The waiter looked at me and asked if I would've have a box to go and I said nope.  Chicken was over cooked and the green watery avocado sauce caused me loose my appetite.

photos.caption: Photo of Frank & Lupe's Old Mexico - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

5suU_Z73dxwOtziIg6IVUg.text: UPDATE:   Frank & Lupe's contacted me and  arranged to have a flan made for me. My husband picked it up and it was marvelous.   I really appreciate it when an establishment goes out of their way to deliver customer service.  ..................  Ok so I have frequented this place often and really love their food.   We ordered takeout our meals and flan. My husband gets there and they ARE OUT OF FLAN. Doesn't ordering something and them telling you to come pick it up mean you will have it?  The flan was literally the reason I chose to order food here. I'm 35 weeks pregnant and crying of anger. Dramatic? Yes   BUT when I order something and am told to come pick it up I expect it will be there. Had they told me they were out in the first place I would have chosen a different place to eat.

_8KSedhDoI52GAEVTnHznQ.text: I'm sad to write this review. In 2014/2015, F & L's used to be one of my top 10 favorite restaurants. The patio is one of the best in old town. Unfortunately, my experience on Saturday night was absolutely horrific. My food came out ice cold (cheese in enchiladas was not even slightly melted, so I don't even think they went in the oven), margaritas tasted awful, we ordered an appetizer that never arrived...just plain bad. I can honestly say I'll probably never go back to this place. So sad.

-tGIuTVgiXdoLyplroLw0A.text: Frank & Lupe's Old Mexico - An Old Scottsdale Favorite from back in the day needs some help today.   This used to be my 2nd favorite Mexican / New Mexican restaurant in Scottsdale.  Today, I hate to say, not so much.  Unfortunately, the service and food do not live up to my found memories a decade or so ago.  I even tried the new Ahwatukee location with the same result.  I ordered my typical combo plate and everything was greasy and didn't have that fresh, perfectly spiced taste I came to love.  I am not sure if it is under new ownership, but something has changed drastically to the quality of the food.  I will say the chips and salsa were very good.  So, if your going in for a margarita or beer, get the chips and salsa to go with!  They still have a great patio out back, I just hope they work on their food quality so I can update this review and give them the 4 stars they used to deserve.

uEYoKSxliZKXhmfBDg6m8A.text: Margaritas are the bomb.  Food is okay, not the best not the worst Mexican.  When you're allergic to cilantro and ask for no cilantro, it shouldn't show up on your plService, well I think we got there between shifts and having to ask for water 3 times and then having to go to bar to actually get it was a bit ridiculous. Beer was a bit warm.

sVsSRKlVoZJ82lzeAAclOw.text: The staff was beyond Friendly and helpful, bilingual which was a Total plus for me. The food well it was Delicious I inhaled it! The ambience was perfection, the company however lol

OiWDmIcwjT4NIpnc3HdLfg.text: Great little Mexicans restaurant if you're looking for some traditional selections. Sat out in the patio area to enjoy the sun. Service was quick and attentive. Food was excellent! Would definitely visit again. :)  We got: 2 house margaritas, Combo #1 (pork tamale, shrimp enchilada, and chicken taco), Combo #4 (shredded beef burrito). It was all great!

photos.caption: Photo of Frank & Lupe's Old Mexico - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Frank & Lupe's Old Mexico - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Frank & Lupe's Old Mexico - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

gZR-ZbqtTAMcJa2klDFc3w.text: Stopped in on a whim looking to get out of the campy area, hoping to find a solid local spot.  Staff is incredibly nice, patient, and helpful.  The owner was quite personable on the way out, and the vibe of the place is quite cool.  The food was just meh. We had a taco platter and Guadalajara tacos...wasn't anything great. A good thing was that they were not greasy, and the rice and beans were very good. Otherwise, nothing to shout about. So many other amazing places in the area, go find them.

FJzoV8sJPjaDzOznngAG3A.text: Let me start this review by saying I think this is one of the best mexican restaurants in Scottsdale, but my review is based on one particularly poor experience. I am hoping the owner/manager will read this and do something about it because I really love this place and want to come back!  So here it is - we went here last night as my roommates mom was in town and really wanted mexican food. We got there and were told it would be a 30 minute wait and to have a seat at the bar outside and we could get a drink while we waited. We proceeded to wait a full hour without hearing anything about our table, or being even given the slightest amount of attention at the bar to order a drink. Meanwhile the place is a mess. there was a table right up front that could have fit us all but hadn't been bussed in a long time, a waiter just spilled an entire plate of food on someone's lap - I'm not sure what was going on, but it seemed like the staff were falling apart, we considered leaving but since we've had such great experiences here before, we wanted to stick it out.  We finally got seated after our long wait and had to wait another full 10 minutes to be given waters. We ordered drinks (which she got our order wrong and forgot one drink) and waited another 15 minutes to get them. For one drink, the waitress didn't know the difference between anejo and respesado tequila, and ended up bringing the complete wrong thing. We again considered just having the drinks and leaving but stayed. At this point, someone at the table saw our waitress take a shot behind the bar while we were anxiously waiting on chips & salsa and for our order to be taken.  Fast forward to when our food came - the food has been amazing in the past and I was super excited. Unfortunately this too was a huge letdown. It was clear that all our orders have been sitting out for some time and were crusty on top. The melted cheese had solidified and was cold. My crunchy taco was now a soft taco (which I sent back). The food was poor quality and a huge letdown.  What I've loved about this place in the past is that if you sit on the patio outside, the atmosphere, food and drinks make you feel like you're transported to Mexico.... but during this visit, we could have felt more like were in Mexico if we went to Taco Bell (which we also considered as an alternative and should have gone instead).  Not sure what is going on, but this place seems to be going downhill fast. I really hope some changes are made.

4-U5NGXkyKBzgX3H0Gusrw.text: Love this joint. Are they perfect? No, but their food is amazing and they make some great drinks.   I personally love their huevos rancheros, cheese crisp, and micheladas.

bLhlz3NqY_gyHCKjLFf_-Q.text: This is my wife and I's favorite place in Arizona! We are so sad to have to leave and go to California without this wonderful restaurant!! The food is just so incredibly good! Service can be slow sometimes but they are usually pretty busy and the way I see it is that all good things take time! I will miss this place!

tbuKi40Aq6sEHlxh5bRZQg.text: Yummm! So good!! The fish tacos, chicken tacos, nachos supreme, mango margarita - mmm, mmm, good! Definitely recommend! Kid friendly!!

CkWNldsLutFhXi0TXk43cg.text: If I could give zero stars I wouldn't first went to the patio for seating and was told by hostess " I don't know how long you'll be waiting we just sat all the tables" no offer to put our name on the list or anything. Went to the front to sit. Most all tables were open. We were seated at a dirty table that a rag was left at. Gross! I should've left after that.. No we were hungry and figured we'd wait any restaurant had we left. Waited another 20 minutes for drink order... Over an hour later food arrives,cold small not very appetizing portions. Had to ask several times for items- drinks, silverware, check... You name it, we had to do their job. Plus my husband got sick a few days after eating. It appeared to be food poisoning to me. Just gross all together. I'd avoid this place at all costs!

PVYSOCjiEMUziytmCt8dcQ.text: One word..."killer!"  Cannot wait to come back someday. Evidently a local gem. Had the tacos combo and they were perfect, even by San Diego standards.

fyCdaeYCcLmLYt-PqDhvPw.text: Nothing exciting.  Service was mediocre.  Only 2 tortillas came with my meal.  Free Chips and Salsa was delicious.  Guacamole was horrible.  It's decent food and my mojito never came bc they were out of mint (but failed to come back to let us know).  Parking looked easy.  Free shuttle nearby.

Ojyr95Ot_Oyw7CarwN639A.text: Great little Mexican restaurant in old town Scottsdale!  Nestled away off Scottsdale blvd so it may be hard to find and is not one of those restaurants you end up walking by as a snowbird tourist.  However, this restaurant, unlike many others in old town Scottsdale, has survived from being torn down, remodeled and renamed something else (like so many others).    The food is what you would expect from a traditional American style restaurant.  This time I had the 3 cheese enchiladas with red sauce that comes with rice and beans. Now, you know your at an old school Mexican restaurant when they offer 10 different varieties of this dish!  Personally, this is what I like.  If you would rather have different varieties of tacos and salads and think you are at a Mexican restaurant then there are others close by.  Just don't expect those other restaurants to be around the next time you come back.

I2_c3mpBgMNQ_BnsGveTDA.text: I don't see how this place was so busy.  The seating arrangement is strange, the service is bad, and the food is terrible!  I came with my husband and 2 year old son.  There is seating in the front of the restaurant where it was hot and humid, and there was seating in the patio.  We decided to sit in the patio are where we were seated by a lady who looked like she hated her job. She seated us, and didn't bring a child's seat for my son.  So, I went to ask her for one.  She rudely told me to give her a minute.  Any time we needed anything, we had to come up to her.  Our visit was nearly 2 hours and she probably checked on us two maybe three times the entire time.  I understand she has a job to do, but being disgruntled with paying customers is inexcusable.   We ordered our food, which took quite a while to come out, and when it finally did, my food was wrong.  I sent it back.  By the time the right food came out, my son and husband had already almost finished their meal.  I didn't want them to wait on me to eat because who knew how long it was going to take for the food to come out again.  We ordered chile rellenos, mini tacos, and carnitas  enchiladas with green sauce.  This place claims to be like "Old Mexico", and the food was by far the furthest from authentic Mexican food. The mini tacos were some frozen store bought "Jose Ole" mini tacos that were fried and served with guac and salsa.  The chile rellenos were made with CHEDDAR cheese.  That is NOT the way we know them to be made.  And the enchiladas were salty beyond belief, and the just plopped the carnitas on top of a cheese enchilada with the weirdest tasting green sauce ever.  They're stingy with their chips while you wait, and super skimp with their sides.  My husband didn't even get nearly a quarter cup of sides.   This place is ridiculous, and is nothing like "Old Mexico", or authentic in anyway.  My husband is Mexican and I have had my fair share of authentic Mexican food, and this place definitely DOES NOT have it.

3-EyTT010q14SjvnrllV8g.text: Good fix for my new mexico style flat enchilada's with an egg on top. Ordered the red with a side of the green sauce to test them both out- both were delicious. The chips are really good but the salsa is really watery, watch out the margaritas are strong! overall very nice, its small and gets packed, dont show up too late for dinner and it can be a bit warm in the small seating area.

photos.caption: Photo of Frank & Lupe's Old Mexico - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. margaritas are STRONG

ZOVi_bFlK0cfaw7S5clNFw.text: Decided to do it again. This time green chili with an egg on top. So New Mex. So good!

photos.caption: Photo of Frank & Lupe's Old Mexico - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

k_yB96pgSEsknarCYHoYyg.text: Have eaten here a couple times and really enjoy the food.  The patio is so cute but the interior of the restaurant is lacking.  So we'll only eat here if we can sit on the patio.  The Mole enchiladas are delicious.  Very reasonable prices especially for Scottsdale!  Not a fancy place like so many others in Old Town, but it's a great place to kick back and relax with friends.  You really do feel like you're in Mexico!

pCrf_92bLsf-R4HdNjKqgg.text: We were very disappointed after the high rating on yelp.  We are Mexican food lovers, but none of the 3 of us enjoyed our meal.  It's unfortunate as it's a great looking funky place and would have been some place to return too.  Unfortunately that won't happen.  The waitress was pleasant and tried to be accommodating to my mother as all of the sauces were much to hot for her, but she needed something a bit more mild.  My husband ordered the mini taco's.  They must have sat under the heat too long as the beef inside  was a hard chunk of something? and the shells were dry and overdone.  They were a very deep golden color.  I ordered the Chimichunga (chicken),  it was 90 % pico inside with less than 3/4 c of bland white meat of chicken.   I opened it up and just ate the chicken. on a positive note...the chips were good.......

P8jmznZreAqWHvSUaIlxwg.text: Where do the locals go to eat Mexican? The same place we send the tourist to! Smilz Frank and Lupes is authentic Mexican food. There outdoor dining area is the preferred seating  The Margaritas are a "must have"  The Mole is absolutely delightful! Not too spicy -- but so very flavorful!

66m0C-Q5aXjRaTO_aShNNw.text: While the food was decent, the service was ABSOLUTELY awful. We came in with a party of 6 on a Saturday night to the main door and the host told us it would be a 20 minute wait but to check the Back Patio room for seating. No one came to seat us for about 10 minutes to start off. The waiter came back very sporadically. We had to find someone to get us water, more chips and drinks. When we asked the waiter about specific menu items, his responses were not really helpful. " well one is pork and the other is beef" in addition, when we asked for a pitcher of water, he brought us a large cup of water with ice.  I had the shrimp enchiladas which were very good but the poor service ruined our experience.

LxteScRCXxix5JT33DPhOQ.text: We stopped for lunch after seeing the restaurant from the Old Scottsdale Trolley. It looked like authentic Mexican food that would be delicious. We were pleased to enjoy the combo plate, fish tacos, and chile relleno! The Pacificos were ice cold with a lime wedge and the perfect touch to a fine lunch! Ask for the hot salsa and you won't be disappointed! We hoped to go back today for breakfast but they're not open until 11am but we'll look forward to our next visit!

1OonylJdeT4QBRi5wRi2Hg.text: I wanted to love this place, I really did. It's cute and the food smelled really good. Unfortunately my take - out order really didn't hit the mark. My coworkers and I ordered a bunch of stuff to go. I had the shredded beef burrito and a cheese crisp. The burrito was in an extremely soggy tortilla. Like soggy to the point of being inedible mush. The beef is riddled with onions and tomatoes. The cheese crisp was buried under a huge pile of onions and tomatoes. The biggest upset was our takeout order did not come with chips. We were told we had to purchase those separately. Yet if you sit down in the restaurant and order the exact same food at the exact same price chips are included. Why is that? I really don't get it. Overall, really disappointing. I can't imagine the need to return here.

Fl70py4yp2nGo8JiXAAygw.text: This is NOT Sonoran or Tex-Mex food. This is New Mexican food and it is excellent. I always get the Lupe's. It is flat cheese enchiladas with a fried egg on top. It is the quintessential New Mexican meal, in my opinion, and Frank and Lupe's obviously know how to make them. My husband has ordered a different entree every time we eat here and has never been disappointed. If you have never had New Mexican food you should give this place a try. Just remember that there are many regional Mexican foods and they are often significantly different from each other.

rXcqfR4EnjWLEoIrtPAvyA.text: Weather permitting, this is a great spot to enjoy outdoor dining in downtown Scottsdale.  The good (Worth 4 stars): * I've never had a bad dish here.   We almost always order Lupe's Enchilada Plate and the Chicken Mole....there are never leftovers, the food is just that good. * Icy cold margaritas and great chips and salsa. * You get sopaipillas with your meals and they are a treat. * They have a great group venue next to the patio.   I hosted a meal for over 30 people there and my guests had a blast.  The not so good (Worth 2 starts): * Yes, the service is pretty awful.   You almost always have to wait and wait for anything you need....whether its a refill on a drink, or more chips and salsa you are left wondering how no one seems to notice or care. * The patio is crowded and the bar is tiny (maybe 4 seats?)  If you do go, there is a limited window of time to enjoy.   Due to the heat, this is primarily an October through April opportunity for lunch....and maybe through May for dinner.  Don't be in any sort of rush or have high expectations for service and you will be just fine here.  Remember the food is 4 stars....its the terrible service that brings it down to 3 stars..

zsD1am9jBT2cVuOtw_HGuw.text: We loved the patio, the friendly service, and great food!   Highly recommend #8, #25.

0h-rtyyAw-j7Vxmmrf5C_Q.text: This is a delightful and friendly place. The chicken mole enchiladas and poblano cream chicken enchiladas were beautiful and delicious. The service was very friendly and attentive. It is near the Scottsdale gallery area and the very wonderful Scottsdale Museum of the West.

1S6nUIpJah22J-lK-NiumA.text: I think that Frank and Lupe's must have had an off night when we got there... It started with a margarita and when they delivered it there was lipstick on a dirty glass. I asked for another and when they made it I could see they just poured the old marg into a new glass. I'm not picky, but thats just a tad bit unprofessional. The chips and salsa were great and my food tasted really good. So why the bad review? Food Poisoning... The next 24 hours of my life after visiting Frank and Lupe's was horrendous. I don't want to disparage a local business but after the experience with the margarita and my time in the emergency room, I can say I will never go back. I suggest the owners of Frank and Lupe's do a top to bottom inspection of their kitchen as I got really, really sick. I looked up the last inspection of the restaurant and it confirms some of why this may have happened: maricopa.gov/envsvc/envw...

ShY5Lz2ucfvEE8rwVBNgxw.text: Delicious fish tacos!! Eating outside is always a plus. Friendly service.  A little slow, though.

T4bkjxgLSUZOaE75G-woaA.text: In a town "Old Town" Scottsdale, AZ, with a lot of Mex restaurants: they are very popular and that says it all. Food quality is very good. Service is fair to poor? Worth going to and then trying some others. There are two separate areas, the colorful bar where I ate, or the very informal restaurant. Then there is a private outside courtyard area next door.

photos.caption: Photo of Frank & Lupe's Old Mexico - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Frank & Lupe's Old Mexico - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

LxvpTkilNxBlYjYylLMGHg.text: Best Mexican food we tried on our trip to Phoenix.   Blue corn tacos with chicken were excellent.  Chili rellenos were fine but a little greasy.  Salsa and chips were the best part. Lots of complaints about the service on yelp but we were treated very well

ke3Z3qBaWDQyZEOBTnTOqQ.text: This place was just ok.  My boyfriend loves their chicken enchiladas.  We were with a party of five and were given our choice of seating when we walked in.  However, I should have known that I wasn't in store for a 5 star experience when the server who was "seating" us just walked away when we chose the table we wanted.  I was left standing there wondering if he was going to go get menus and then seat us or if we were supposed to just go sit down.  Kind of awkward.    Food was also just average.  The bf still enjoyed his chicken enchiladas.  I should also add that he initially ordered the wrong enchilada plate and when it came to the table the server was very accommodating about taking it back and getting the correct entree.  I had the carnitas taco special which was two tacos with rice and beans.  I specifically asked about what kind of tortillas the tacos were made with and the server said they were hard shell tacos.  When they arrived the tortillas were corn, greasy and soft.  Not so good.  My mom's soft tacos were strangely served upside down.  I was also the only at the table who was served refried rather than whole beans.  Not sure if that was part of the special, but thought it was kind of strange.    I loved that they served sopapillas with dinner.  Prices are reasonable and service was fair.  It was an ok experience but with other better places I don't know that I would choose to go back.

T_BAHxIrQQB8okAv_6c1Ew.text: The only thing that must keep this place alive is a great outdoor patio and good location. The service is awful, as in it's painfully obvious the management has no commitment to serving the customer. Sat down on a less than busy Sunday evening, and waited 15 minutes before drink orders were taken. After emptying the first glass the food arrived, and the drinks were not refilled until 3/4 of the way through the meal. What server doesn't check in on drinks, especially when the food arrives? I also had to go to the bar to get my silverware. The food is at the lower end of the spectrum on quality, considering the multitude of options.    I was angry when I paid the bill, and wish I had picked someplace else. With a lot of options, this place is a no go. Take Filberto's to the park, and the squirrels will likely service you better. Win -win.   Plus, don't order an extra basket of chips, that will cost you. WTF.

2tR_Gmw1Se6k-N2uawLFSg.text: Lots of reasons to go to F&L's:  1) Food is made fresh. Yes, it takes time to make food from scratch instead of heating up pre-prepared dishes. So, sit back and enjoy your drink and the chips and salsa.  2) Special orders are happily accommodated. I wanted the the rolled enchiladas but with veggies instead of the other options (beef, chicken or spinach). The waiter (actually the manager since our waiter was busy) happily accommodated my order as well as giving me the option to have either or both of the green and red sauce (the red is better).  3) Huge portions. Yes, I'm small but I have a big appetite. Lunch at F&L's held me over until 8 p.m.!  4) Warm sopapillas. Warm, deep-fried bready goodness with lots of honey. What more could you want?  5) Location. Nestled in the midst of galleries, boutiques and other retail stores. I'd suggest starting your day at F&Ls so you are ready to spend the rest of your day in the surrounding area, only to break for the 5 p.m. martini.

FNRzKkMbQi1L61seXDTiYA.text: Sometime it's not about the food...when you're all about hanging out with a couple of good friends and enjoying the balmy Phoenix evening...then this is where Frank & Lupe shines  We had enchilada, chicken in mole sauce, fish tacos and beef flautas...nothing really stood out as being particularly good or bad...and the wait staff was somewhat lackadaisical in their attention to service...but washing it all down with pitchers of ice cold margarita was a more than pleasant way to end our Monday  So just 2.5 stars for the food, but we'd be back for more good times on the outdoor back patio.

BRsgAz0nCHUiSfQtdNQFbw.text: I'm back and forth on this place. On one hand, I've had superific wonderful delicious experiences filled with impeccable service and great food. On the other hand - there was today.  - No server for about 15 minutes  - No chips and salsa 'til we asked (then they took forever to bring the chips)   - Ordered drinks that never arrived  - Ordered guacamole that never arrived  - Waiter was retarded and sucky, possibly just a random man who walked in and pretended to be a waiter as we would ask him for stuff and he would never deliver  - Random waitress stops by to find out if we ordered yet. We tell her "no." So she takes our order.  - While you are at it , sister: Where is our soda and chips and gauc??? She looks horrified and brings them promptly. Thank you waitress lady and no thank you to you sh*tty waiter #1  - Food takes billions of years. Possibly trillions.  - We ask where food is at, yo.   - They find our food.  - It's a little dry (like, no sauce on the enchilada's bro)  - But otherwise food is good  But wait... there's more...   - Where are our utensils???  - Waiter says we can have forks, but no knives.
