Hence the warning about eating undercooked food next to it.  On the menu I noticed meat was $2 extra so since it was already $10 I decided to go lite. When the waiter took my order, he asked if I wanted chicken or beef like it came with it and I just had to choose. Not "did I want to add it to my meal". Figuring I read the menu wrong I choose chicken. When the bill came, I saw that $2 charge. The waiter was nice enough but that left a bad taste in my mouth.  As for the entree it was good though. The sopapillas that it comes with I thought were pretty lacking. It's flat pieces of dough that are fried. Normally fried anything is good but this was meh. I agree with one yelper, it should come out after the meal, not during.  And it should come out hot. It was cold fried dough served with bottle of honey.  I would have normally rated this place with 2 stars bc of the not so honestness of the waiter but the 3rd star goes out to the bus woman who I think worked the hardest at customer service there. She was pleasant and helpful when we needed here. Since we didnt see our waiter that often, she made a difference. She's the one who took care of us better. Props to her!

NL5sUpHRFlaMAvN80-N08w.text: I was sooooo excited to see the stuffed sopapillas on the menu!  I can't find them anywhere.   Alas,  they weren't what I was expecting.  The sopapillas where small and flattened (a little like tortillas).  The beef and red chili was placed on top ( not stuffed).  The dish was tasty but disappointing.  At least the beer specials are good.  Of all the Mexican food places I've been to in the neighborhood so far...this one is the best.

OPZ-dS-ej7-QSR_HBTO6VA.text: I have been to this restaurant probably about a dozen times. I am originally from Mexico City and loved the fact that there is a Mexican restaurant in Old Town similar to an authentic Mexican restaurant. It's a cute little place, with charm, and old style architecture. The many times I have been here, service has been OK, and the food is nothing authentic but it is still decent.   Today, I decided to have a nice lunch with my boyfriend and we got seated right away. We waited around 7-10 minutes before we were even acknowledged. The waiter came over and asked what we liked to drink. We ordered 2 waters, a pepsi, and a margarita. When the server came back, he forgot our waters and had to remind him 10 minutes later. Previously we had ordered our food and came out incredibly fast which was awesome! After that, we were completely ignored. Pepsi wasn't refilled. He hadn't asked how everything was or if we needed anything else. Pretty much made our dining experience very unpleasant.   I work for Fox restaurants which has a great reputation for awesome food and excellent service. I more than anyone understand when things don't run smoothly or people make mistakes but my god, he was literally looking around the small room to see what needed to be done and his awareness level was at a 3. When we were all done, he finally asked if we were "ok" and he took our plates away. Did not ask us if we wanted dessert or anything. The bill was 42$ and left him a $4 tip which makes me feel terrible but I know he was definitely not working for it.  I am extremely disappointed this time and don't think I will be coming back for a while.

F_uOf0z8wFUmTVJeG2CrVA.text: I've been to Frank & Lupes more times then I can count because of its close location and great food. Everything I've tried has been delicious especially the enchiladas and shredded beef tacos. Margaritas are nice and tasty too. Chips and Salsa are addictive but only the first bowl is free. Refills are $2. (Always get them on the come back...)   The service however is lacking. More then one occasion, I would have to flag down a waiter for water, refills and even the bill. Sitting in the dining room versus the covered patio makes no difference in service. I have never been to the patio area out back. But if you are in the mood for good Mexican food and you are not in a hurry, this is a good place. (I have to disclose that I have only been here on Friday nights where service is extremely slow. I recently stopped by early Saturday Night and the service was attentive! So maybe it's just the staff on weeknights.)

seZcLiNPp4lhKc87FJfUIA.text: It's not often when I'm impressed by a Mexican restaurant, but this place blew me away. It's honestly the best mexican food I have ever eaten.  Their "holy mole" is to die for. Service is slow, but super friendly.

3Ir9bikznN37JTEjEJN5oA.text: First of all, I have NO IDEA what these bad reviews are of this restaurant. I'm an excellent cook myself, and I know crap a mile away - but this food was excellent.    We had a 20-30 minute wait last Saturday night - totally expected. Surprised it was not longer. Place was packed!   Server was quick, and the food was extremely good. I had the chicken mole enchiladas and they were delicious. Chips were very good - and I do not know what people are complaining about with the salsa. It was 'different than other Mexican restaurants'  but I think that too is one of the things that sets this restaurant apart - in a good way!  Service was attentive, yet unobtrusive. I will look forward to returning to Frank and Lupe's.

TbPndUGzdeFiEas4mgw9Wg.text: Stopped at Frank & Lupes 2 weeks ago. Sat outside and they didn't have the musters on which was a bit strange. The margaritas were okay but the beer menu seemed a bit small. Nachos were yummy. But between the 3 orders for dinner, we had issues with all 3. They forgot our order, friend order shredded chicken but they said they didn't have shredded chicken (even though it says it on the menu), and they didn't bring the last persons sopapillas. Definitely would not go back.

k4VhgwwV6l2IxCbPoXZTPQ.text: Don't expect a plate with your chips and don't expect your dip to taste like anything like salsa or edible but more like something without any expensive ingredients but hot and without any tomatoes but perhaps something from a can or jar from a discount place. Don't expect your water to have lemon even if you ask and the chlorine/chemical stuff that tastes worse than tap water will be given to you. Your waiter will never come back only someone with a "bad attitude" from the kitchen that if you don't answer their question fast enough your food will just be dropped in front of you. If you are stunned with the lack of anything related to "fine dining" but moreover a 100% "Tourist Trap" then you will run and never look back. Yes I live here and yes I have had some food prepared OK in the past but I always leave "pissed off" angry, hungry and wishing I had not donated my money to the "jerks" that run the place. The food is bland and is less than a "Taco Bell" in terms of any value. The cooks that wait on you have a totally "bad attitude" and they know what kind of crap they are serving so don't be surprised if you try to actually eat there expecting anything at all. Terrible food, terrible service and a depressing place to be.

DcVWTQe5UQ1cD_7gKyTgBg.text: This was the absolute worst place we've ever went. The experience was so horrible my fiance broke up with me. The beans and rice were so soggy I thought they were rice patties. The place smelt like rotten beans. The server came up to us (no need for a margarita) she gave so many suggestions we felt drunk by the time she was done. Completely rude staff that totally ignored us and were in the back watching nogales. The drink was weak. I left the place feeling hopeless, hungry and now single. Thanks a lot frank n Lupe....I hope your happy.

O0BH6kE9NUXvV_u6AKKTYw.text: Part of the initial thrill was beating the rush. However, the waiter's control and pace of service let us savor the balmy November day, and the Mexican eats, on their fun patio. Salsa is unique and has great kick, served with homemade chips. Flautas and tacos were packed with shredded beef and served with perfect beans. Although customers were pouring in for lunch, the waiter never rushed us. WOW.    Margarita menu was reasonable and tempting! Next time....soon.

ZIa-g_FHhaaa2FdLjGMfsA.text: If I mosey over to Scottsdale, this is where I go for Mexican food. The poblano enchiladas (#8) is a must and it's their staple dish. I get it every time I go. Most of the time the service is personable and excellent! Buena gente! I have had one bad experience here sitting in the patio area. Our server, who I have only seen that time, did not take orders for 15 minutes. Otherwise, I love franks! Did I say get the #8?!?!

GZuiZPBBzDZFbPFLvB6J0g.text: This place is awesome. Definitely go around back and sit in the patio. The atmosphere is great, especially on a warm night. The staff is friendly and the skinny margaritas are delicious. Go with pitchers.  I had Lupe's enchiladas which are really like huevos rancheros and I was not disappointed - the food is delicious. The price is right and it's authentic. Highly recommended.

2qjznUkYdBdeZDtSoz3VTg.text: Food is average. Service is poor. Can't make a cheese crisp with green chilies without it being soggy.  Server never once came to check on my or refill my drink. Its been this way the last 3 times I was here. I used to like it.

g3ZugxlLOI7KmU5onIRB0Q.text: Chips were not greasy as mentioned before. Great patio with ambiance. Lots of food for the money. Will come back!

BuWMUqzwvFVMOgeuYChn-Q.text: We were excite to eat here as a golf cart highly reccomended it -  the place is just OK.  We sat outside.  There were only a few tables and we hd really slow service.  Chips took 10 minutes and had to ask for soda refills.  The flies were annoying too. I woulda gave a 2 star but the bathroom was the coldest in scottsdale and felt good

cf7bbY7V2cPiluem7uHwzQ.text: Food was excellent,  service was great, and they have a really nice patio.  Certainly one my favorite Mexican places.  You must try the queso!!!

qehjj6svd9ilHpACGZUczw.text: Always a great place to stop for lunch or dinner. Very consistent service, good food, tasty margaritas. Sit out on the patio if not too hot. Good family place.

dgi1GAwgu-t3TdQfQie8fA.text: My family has been eating here for 13 years. We come from New Mexico and our Mexican food is different. We love it here...almost like home. The patio is amazing for margaritas any time. They are half priced for happy hour :)

DEtaGih6QVUje954lPWGBg.text: Decided to give Frank & Lupe's another shot since we were heading to Brush Bar again for an evening of painting fun. Disappointed doesn't even begin to cut it.   The service was indifferent, rude, and was clearly not interested in us just like the previous visit. We were seated right in the main dining room so no matter what our server had to do, he had to walk by us each and every time. He forgot drinks, food was served to us cold, didn't even bring the appetizer we ordered. If he tried any harder to ignore us, it would have been downright funny.   The biggest turn off was the glass of water he served to one of my dinner guests which was rimmed with ANTS. It was almost like they dipped the rim of the glass into a whole pile of the dead ants before serving it. How he missed it, I'll never know. It was disgusting. Not an apology. Not a discount offered. Nothing.   This was the most piss-poor service I have received in a restaurant in a long time and you can bet your last dime it's the last time Frank & Lupe's will ever see me or the 8 other guests I brought.

nXcyjX58htbyMcJZD6nj-w.text: Peter B.'s review on you needs to be addressed. He is gen'l mgr of La Pinata in Phoenix.

gmEdQ9I9FbkFszKIC8IZTA.text: Oh yeah. This fits the bill. In town from the east coast, though I grew up the southwest. Didn't want fancy Latin cuisine,trendy street tacos or a modern setting. Just good old Mexican food. And it ALL starts with the chips and salsa. Check. Margarita. Check. Combo #1 check. (Love a combo). Great service and darling neighborhood were bonuses.

IUIfSKUzf6uXbAKnJ-kixg.text: Food was delicious! If you are unsure what "authentic" Mexican food is, double check with your server about he plate you are interested in before ordering. Great outdoor patio. Slow service. Great house margarita!

BpQvKkm9-Mbtbu1XwkEI3Q.text: She ain't what she used to be! We went to its patio and wanted to carry on our ten year tradition of eating outdoors on the patio, even tho it was a bit cool...all but two of the heaters were almost out of  heating oil so we went inside. Poor staff, not enough servers and the food keeps getting skimpier in portions even though the price has gone up. This will be our last time of coming here. They continue to skimp on quality, and that's where we are drawing the line. Adios! There are many other good Mexican restaurants in town!

ocjYy1DmC8RrVqkk34P0PQ.text: Great food & great price in Scottsdale's Art district.  Shredded beef chimichangas were spicy and good sized. Chicken enchilada was great and homemade tortilla made it even better !

JNT1now0K00Kyoeu1RuBHg.text: The patio here is great! Wonderful atmosphere! Got a pitcher of margaritas which were delicious. And the food is muy bueno! Everything at great prices too. We will definitely be coming back! What a great little spot to hang out :)

gParIxHbUSQDaMXT2csJnA.text: Dropped in on a Saturday night and ate indoors.  I understand when people say about getting a table,  but I am used to this service at Asian places.  I just flagged down the first person I saw and asked where I could sit.  There have been lots of reviews on what the restaurant looks like, so I'm going straight to the food.  We ordered the chimichangas and enchiladas.  The salsa that came with the chips was okay.  It could've used some cilantro to brighten it up.  The two entrees was nothing special.  Rice was a little dry, beans okay.  The chimi had a lot of beef in it, but the sauce was not that great.  The enchiladas were flimsy and drenched in this forgettable poblano cream sauce.  I thought the food was.. well like the rating says meh.  I wouldn't recommend anyone going there if they have a kick for Mexican food.  There are plenty of other places around that taste better.  For upscale, I'd try Spotted Donkey or Mission.  For something a little more relaxed, just take scottsdale south, and there'll be Los Sombreros on the right side.

9fgEOXPXCytY7mmgedbTAA.text: Horrible experience, was seated outside in the cold with two babies heaters didn't work gave us the wrong drinks so we decided to leave and they charged us $35 for the drinks that we didn't drink cause they were all wrong. Super horrible service at that! Never again for us

NpGfYuwdLUkUTx6p2MUffg.text: It took us 4 months to get around to trying this place...we heard about this place from a colleague and were hesitant because of the lower star rating. We are sad we waited because we love it! We are native New Mexicans and have been very disappointed with the food here. This has become our new go-to Mexican food restaurant, hands down. I, personally, love the Poblano Cream Enchiladas - I'm salivating as I type. We have only eaten in the restaurant and have not been to the patio. We have been for lunch and then around 7 pm and it's been moderately busy and service has been good. Staff is friendly and accommodating. This place is located among a bunch of shops in downtown Scottsdale - so parking is spotty. They have their own lot but it's often full. My only complaint is that the tea isn't so great!  Give this place a try!

photos.caption: Photo of Frank & Lupe's Old Mexico - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Chips and salsa!
Photo of Frank & Lupe's Old Mexico - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Menu2
Photo of Frank & Lupe's Old Mexico - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Menu

0AEfYWWaqzNhTr-NDcv5Jw.text: Frank & Lupe's is always a solid choice for authentic Mexican food and great drinks in a fun and relaxed atmosphere.   This place isn't supposed to be fancy like The Mission and isn't just a Scottsdale bar posing as a restaurant.  It's just a great place for casual dining with friends in Old Town.

oklVZYlUGxanZlogMr-PSQ.text: Good, solid Mexican food for white people; your relatives from Iowa will love it. Everything is smothered in cheese and comes with a uniform scoop of guacamole. About the best that you will get in Scottsdale, which is not exactly a hotbed of authentic Mexican food.

dggr3HpbF4zA1QXJpIW-tw.text: This place is really fun and it was so nice to sit outside and enjoy the sunshine while stuffing our faces with chips, salsa, fresh gauc and the tastiest blue corn taquitos I've had - hands down!  Each plate is served with a generous helping of Mexican rice and beans and the service was really great.  Prices were $8-$10/plate which made it all the better and reason to return!

zEdYwkYDsWS02IjT6Jriag.text: Some of the best, authentic Mexican food I've ever had! So flavorful and addicting it's impossible not to over eat.....def recommend!

Nt-IVsySWQHwFURRzbvAIA.text: Not great. Place was packed so sat at the bar. Hard to get anyone's attention. Ordered a combo plate and it showed up barely lukewarm and not very tasty.  I remember this place differently in the past.  Think it has gone downhill.

x8HpOwhnwIJkywXIy3kZMg.text: Great atmosphere good food excellent service.  I go to here every trip to Scottsdale.

35JX9hs3154-YNds52BQDQ.text: My favorite Mexican restaurant anywhere! The chilies are from Hatch, NM. The original restaurant is in Socorro, NM. The best dishes are from the Santa Fe style of Mexican food and best of all there ain't no stinkin'  tomatoes in the enchilada sauce. I personally recommend to go no further on the menu than the Frank's platter with extra red sauce...It's a dish that's been around for centuries and for obvious reasons. Everything is freshly made...and in the past I've brought my own container and purchased the red sauce to take back to the east coast... Oh yeah, say hi to Teddy, the owner, if he's there, Frank's younger son, great guy...

Hvzt2-boWfgpAnBW1vudVw.text: You're kidding me, right?  A friend from out of town told me this was his favorite Mexican restaurant in AZ.  Lesson #1.....Never listen to an out-of-towner on Mexican restaurant recommendations.    Living in Scottsdale since 1980 I can see why my friends have always suggested other Mexican restaurants in town.  Weak drinks, very slow service, greasy chips and a fajita dinner on a dinner plate instead of a sizzling iron skillet.  I told my neighbor on Christmas Eve that we went to Frank & Lupes and his comment to me was "WHY??".   I would rather drive out to San Tan Village to Cantina Laredo than suffer through another Frank & Lupe's experience again.

GrdUQLCIjss6bIpUwkvzdA.text: I couldn't even try the food because the service was horrible! We were seated right away but no one ever came to take our drink order so we left. On the way out my husband informed them why we were leaving and their response was "ok good, have a good night", and then went on to tell the people waiting that they just had a table free up. I have never in my life been treated so poorly and I highly recommend staying far FAR away from this crap hole!!

0wlruCSdIvr3pasia0s5Qg.text: Original food, pretty good. Service fair good margaritas. Not a big hurry to revisit. Has to be better.

photos.caption: Photo of Frank & Lupe's Old Mexico - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Authentic mexican.

Eq5MiX6nYy2Q4RMiPTkhWA.text: Love this place! My favorite Mexican food place-to-eat-at since 1980! I love the spinach enchiladas! The back patio has a great feel of Mexico to it. Nothing like sitting back there on a cool evening. The staff is always friendly and helpful. Family owned...always a draw for me. I always look forward to my times at Frank & Lupe's.

zFdPcLF5poEw6JeKYgUEhQ.text: Great food. Great ambience. Great service.  Check it out next time you're in Scottsdale. Just a quick walk from downtown.

8314rMI3Q2hrI-4oWfYkDg.text: Great ambiance, really cute. Food and drink mediocre at best. They claim to have a "taquileria" suggesting a wide selection, but all they gad was about four standard brands. Not going back.

dYblllsrMVKuYa_vlOtBgQ.text: I LOVE Mexican food and this is some of the best I've ever had! The refried beans ARE the best I've ever had! Great location, very nice staff. I'm traveling back to Scottsdale just to eat here again!

c9_bOEY8zqJd5XNOrT0l3w.text: Do not eat at this restaurant.  So horrible.  I came in for lunch.  First of all, no lunch specials.  (WHAT)?  I was seated immediately on the patio, then ignored.  (For too long).  The patio was not busy either.  I ordered the Chile Relleno plate.  It didn't take too long to come out, because it was clearly microwaved.  I picked up a fork full of rice and they had spread a handful of shredded cheese on top, then microwaved it, (I could tell because the whole spread of shredded cheese came up with my fork on a little pull of rice).  The rice was old, not fresh at all.  The Chile Relleno was more than likely frozen, it was definitely not fresh, not authentic AT ALL.  I ordered an ice tea, and it was warm.  I had to ask the bartender on the patio for a slice of lemon.  The waitress was nice, *when I saw her, but the food was ABSOLUTELY HORRIBLE.  I could get better at Filiberto's.  Save your money, SO DISAPPOINTING.  I should have asked for a refund, but, you know, live and learn.  VISITORS TO SCOTTSDALE, DO NOT EAT HERE.  GO ANYWHERE ELSE!!!!  This restaurant gives Old Town Scottsdale a bad name.

RWA-D6GPFrn_d6kplwR7IQ.text: Small authentic Mexican restaurant nestled in old town Scottsdale. We sat on the hidden outdoor patio that offers plenty of shade from the merciless Arizona sun.  We arrived around 1130 and the patio was wide open but by noon all the tables were filled with locals and tourists alike.  Prices are very reasonable, around 8-10 bucks each and we enjoyed a couple of great margaritas in the warm Arizona sunshine.  The chicken tacos were good, but the standout was the soft chicken tacos covered in poblano cream sauce - unbelievably good.  We also liked their chips and salsa.  Service was a bit uneven but we didn't mind, it was great to escape the winter and just bathe in the warmth.

photos.caption: Photo of Frank & Lupe's Old Mexico - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Frank & Lupe's Old Mexico - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Hidden patio at Frank &amp; Lupe

BWrea1UkYuR8Rm5sB1xfiQ.text: A staple restaurant in old town Scottsdale especially if you're looking for traditional Mexican food. The food is decent and the price is pretty good especially for portion size. It's nothing to write home about, but with all the food option in the area, this is the closest you will get to traditional Mexican food. However, the restaurant is usually busy including the patio cantina so expect to wait a bit. You can order beers and homemade margaritas at the bar while you wait though. Service is also a little slow due to how busy the place is but they manage to do their best and the free chips and salsa with refill make the wait bearable.

pGRMq6oR8c_Kzk_1VLwqTQ.text: My husband and I were looking for a place that was open for lunch and this was it! Small quaint place in Scottsdale where we could relax and eat a terrific lunch. The sopapillas were one of my favorite things on the menu. I had the shredded beef burrito with green pablano sauce which was amazing and the chips and salsa were made fresh not bag chips!

photos.caption: Photo of Frank & Lupe's Old Mexico - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Shredded beef burrito with green pablano sauce
Photo of Frank & Lupe's Old Mexico - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. The food here was amazing having a wonderful lunch with my honey !

j3zQqKhEyZ68ecvr4T4VJQ.text: Wonderful tamales, tacos, and laid back vibe. Alfredo took great care of us. The poblano cream chicken enchiladas were awesome!

fn8BNBJ0j2_l7WP0pGqGbQ.text: This is a favorite spot. Food is delicious. Margaritas great. Service okay. Atmosphere is fun, good people watching.

l2pF35sWdEeuM1TmwpNofA.text: Very good Mexican Sonoran food that has been here for many many years. Very traditional fun friendly attentive staff that is here to serve with a smile. If you're looking for traditional Mexican food check this place out.

photos.caption: Photo of Frank & Lupe's Old Mexico - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Stuffed Chicken poblano
Photo of Frank & Lupe's Old Mexico - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Beef fajitas
Photo of Frank & Lupe's Old Mexico - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

vpvVaJ1WJECxG0fFr7mg9A.text: Uhg, I hate to give this under 4 stars because it literally used to be a childhood favorite and a family Saturday afternoon tradition {especially after hiking Camelback}! Unfortunately, the service and food just aren't the same.   My mom and I popped in here for a late lunch last Saturday around 2:30 PM. It wasn't super busy and we just wanted to order something small. We ordered a cheese crisp w/guacamole to split and I ordered 1 beef taco. The cheese crisp was SUPER greasy {I know, I know, cheese crisps are normally greasy but this one seemed over the top}. The guac was super bland, literally just mashed avocado and nothing extra special. My taco was ok, but not incredible {greasy too!}. I do still love their chips and salsa. At least they're still the same as I remember!  The main reason for my 3 stars is the service. We were there during "off" hours, it wasn't super busy, and the room that everyone was seated in was super small but it seemed as though our waiter was ignoring us when we wanted to pay the bill. We were trying to stare him down and finally my mom starting waving her credit card at him and he STILL pretended he didn't see us! It was crazy. We waited at least 15 minutes with dirty dishes on the table and no one bringing the check.   Anywho, i'm not sure if we'll be back because there are so many fantastic Mexican restaurants in the Valley. Major bummer!

zSQTbWm1nT_AWZQYzLpN1g.text: Great Mexican Food for the price....Happy Hour Margaritas really good for $ 6.00...Salsa is outstanding along with house made chips....Had the Chicken Mole Enchiladas,   OUTSTANDING, WILL BE BACK SOON!!

d3SDnSfViMZrmjLotpLZCQ.text: Went here for the first time on 7/21/18 for lunch with my mom who is 83 and my 19 year old son. Loved the food. Great service. Had chicken with mole sauce...fantastic flavor. Everyone enjoyed their food and we all look forward to returning again.

XvxBpivWCOhWc25g8Q1hRA.text: Really unfortunate attempt to eat at this establishment. We work in the area and after all the recommendations decided to visit. We arrived at 8:59pm and poked our heads in the door. I asked the bar staff if they were in fact closed as the website said closing time was 10pm. After the employee took maybe 5 seconds or so to think about it. We were told they are closed now. Too bad for them as we'll not be back for poor business like this.

xg1PY3mjHy8HpYwsobiUyA.text: Nice local place. A little disappointed in selection.  Service was great. Waiter really cared...Ricky.  Try and enjoy

L2d_lEK9b5ZVP4WXpcPeBA.text: Love love the ceviche they put a lot of shrimp, avocado, and the celery was fresh.  I really like the sauce everything was marinated in.  The only down fall is the waitress didn't come check on us. We were out of drinks had to wait and than wave someone down. The restaurant wasn't the busy at all. I would have given them a four on their food alone but the service was slow.

MWBw38kAeyn4q9J2FUWejg.text: Very disappointing. Looking forward to authentic Mexican and not even close. Ordered a chicken chimichanga and it came out burnt and tough shell. Sour cream and guacamole very thin and no flavor. Asked for hot sauce and they only had a red sauce that didn't come close to a Tabasco. Cadillac margarita was so so and very expensive. Not worth the time or $$ for dinner. We will go elsewhere.

CU0bRfWyTiD59JuS8aJOkg.text: The quality of the food and service at Frank & Lupe's has declined to the point of being below average.  The food was cold and the service was even colder. I order a two items plate with rice and beans. My order was brought on 4 separate plates. I asked the waitress to put the food on one plate. She said the kitchen made a mistake and then proceeded to dump my chile relleno on to the plate with the enchilada. Now I had 3 plates and it was my tough luck.  Not only was the food cold it wasn't very tasty. In addition, The waitress never asked us if we wanted a second drink or dessert.  I'll never go back to this Old Town establishment.

R2QK2KVhM6TzSHKBe7G6Pg.text: The first time I came in was over 8+ years & lived in the area. I was expecting Sonoran Mexican so I was disappointed & found the salsa lacking heat. Fast forward a few years & had some friends that swore this was the best New Mexican they'd had since moving from NM. So I gave it another shot going in not expecting Sonoran & was happy with everything I got which was a combo taco, enchilada with rice & beans. See I was still trying to hedge my bets after my first experience. The friends I was with knew to ask for the hotter salsa & I liked that too.  Next time I was visiting the area for a date night I was waiting for my room to be ready on a Friday afternoon & wandered in looking for a happy hour. They have good happy hour specials on drinks & appetizers. On this visit I had some apps & margaritas. I enjoyed the bean dip, chips & guacamole.  Went back again after these good visits & tried the happy hour again but on the outdoor patio & LOVED it. The patio was full very soon after arriving so arrive early if you want a seat on the patio. I had the happy hour house margarita, Modello Negra & Michelada all are good. If you're looking for a fancy margarita with only fresh ingredients aka not a mix skip the house margarita, They do have some other Cadillac margaritas on the menu they aren't on happy hour & those are head & shoulders above the happy hour & sooo good.  I'm looking forward to returning for another date night. One other suggestion is to know they close early on the weekends at 10 so start your night here.

fCnM2-TjipgigXvQn62KCQ.text: Some of the best Mexican food I've had in a long time! I will definitely be back and recommend to others.

photos.caption: Photo of Frank & Lupe's Old Mexico - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. So good! No complaints here! I&#39;ll be back for sure.

O609v_SzWgJsgUpFU2t4NA.text: Cute place and great service. I enjoyed my meal. Very fresh and delicious. The chips and salsa were great. Salsa had some heat and was the perfect snack.   The chicken chimichanga was fresh and well seasoned. The prices are a bit high in my opinion.

photos.caption: Photo of Frank & Lupe's Old Mexico - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Frank & Lupe's Old Mexico - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

EfPClwOCMbYJBZq2ePa3cw.text: This is our go to Mexican restaurant. Always fresh and always delicious. Homemade chips and salsa. Our favorite is the adobada plate.

P1b1xPWR0KeTr62AJ4mZLQ.text: Place looks good and authentic, first of all they had no iced tea or soda. The food was edible but not at all what we expected tho. Usually when I order enchiladas they come with a red or green enchilada sauce the enchiladas here come out naked, I added beef to mine, I'm glad I did because it would have just been cheese with a corn tortilla. Very dissatisfied with the entire visit I won't be back

b_d4iBlsHU881O1AlNw2EQ.text: Took a group of folks here for diner while visiting on business. Once again I was NOT disappointed. I had the Beef Chimichanga and it was excellent. Service was good. I will repeat when in the area again.

Fjn42ie4-l8YoWBrTT5rIQ.text: This is my FAVORITE place to eat at in Scottsdale! Even Muhammad Ali used to love eating here. Order the #8!!!!!! The poblano sauce will rock your world. The chips and salsa are the best I've ever had and go great with their huge margarita. The service and owners are absolutely wonderful. I'll always crave this place when I'm not in Arizona and will make sure it's my first stop every time I'm back. Love Frank & Lupe's!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Frank & Lupe's Old Mexico - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

N-5cVnxrACfY8y5FXxLmcA.text: We used to love this place but haven't been here in a while.  Used to be very popular but now we know why it was almost empty. We won't be back - bad service, bad food but the chips & salsa are good. Adios!

kw3kP7ChHhiXsaAiTXky6g.text: Great place for Mexican. Service was fast and friendly. Love the old school feel. Will go again.

aJyDjCUiBP-ETWtRNzCk4A.text: Overpriced and overrated. Bathroom situation horrible. It takes at least 10 minutes to walk to the restroom if your seated in the front room and then you gotta get real lucky scoring one of one stall bathrooms to actually do what you gotta do. Moving onto the food, there are no lunch specials available, so you must select off the high priced dinner/lunch menu. Whoever is saying that this salsa is good is clearly off their rocker. It is a watery mess with nothing in the salsa. It is more like a bowl of Frank's red Hot Sauce than a True salsa experience. Chips though were tasty and seemed homemade, but doubt it now. Our lunch choices were the Chicken Mole and one of those tortilla shell salads from the 80's. Her dish was quite standard and I heard no complaints, but my mole had some issues. Smartass waiter said this wasn't a hot item and mole typically isn't, but 1/4 of the way through, this gringo started heavy sweating. Then we have the chicken which did not seem like real chicken. Plus the dish was chicken mole enchiladads, but all they did was give me two cheese enchiladas with some nasty chicken on top and then that horrible mole sauce at a price of almost 12 bucks.     Frank and Lupe's time has come and gone. How bout remodeling your cramped front room and modernizing your bathroom facilities while your at it. Scottsdale garbage.

photos.caption: Photo of Frank & Lupe's Old Mexico - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Taco salad
Photo of Frank & Lupe's Old Mexico - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Bad mole

0hNvY9QH3EOY7S6mUJJZ2g.text: pretty good. nostalgic environment and tasty food, but typical scottsdale overpricing.

7M-Okj3mUy3b1CBzfIKrTw.text: Got terrible food poisoning!  7 out of the 8 of us that went got violently ill.  Only my 3 year old son did not get it bc he refused to eat that night (thankfully). Even my 16 month old vommitted 5x and we almost had to take her to the ER.  Very scary!  The manager seemed minimally concerned when we called him.  The owner said he would refund us our money but has still not done so in over a week and will not return my calls.  It just doesn't seem like they care.

oYWzqLWdCioT4boC3HdvhQ.text: Amazing food, but the service is always slow, and they charge for refills on chips. I feel like if you're paying $12-18 for your food, they should have free refills on chips, call me crazy.

Er270l5eFrQuXpWBmlNC9w.text: I went here for the first time a few months ago and ordered the shredded beef tacos; the beef was cooked to perfection. Every time I come back I get the same. Chips are also good. Additionally, this place is quite affordable considering its Old Town location.

jisJGNoTNlNolAhzhIo1vw.text: No thanks, everything smothered in bland sauce, cheese, sour cream and lettuce. No Mexicans eating here speaks volumes.

luRF0hjI1dzQLg-XtDSl2A.text: Terrible customer service and obviously management issues. Website, yelp, Google says closes at 10PM on Sunday. We arrived at 8:45 to be told were slow so the kitchen closed. Then told we can get your food in but we're closed. So, no relaxing, enjoying and eating. I guess always call before arriving.....? Terrible management. Change your advertising if you "close early when slow." Will never recommend or try again.

3vP5M68skyo1JQAP0cXTOA.text: Food was very bland, bland,bland. Mexican food should not be bland.  Had the chimaconga, was nice and flaky but needed seasonings.  Had the fish tacos again had no flavors!

uvV-ZrPtMlITGkBgZoSJhQ.text: The most amazing enchiladas! I've been here many times and keep coming back with family and friends. Very cute patio and atmosphere. Happy hour is from 3-6pm, with generously sized margaritas!

bCNn_jXHBf77Kl2tKvcIeQ.text: Met friends for dinner here last night. Food was delicious, we both had the #8 plate, smooth, slightly spicy with a green cream sauce. The entire bill for 4 of including drinks was only $75, good deal for the quality.

IB1EH2SzJc4ZJ0wlPZfPmA.text: This place gets 3 stars from most.  2 from me.  Nothing special except the patio atmosphere was nice.  Margarita nothing special but was $9.  Guac had no flavor.   Food average at best.  Service was fast but unfriendly.  Have not been anywhere else for Mexican yet but I hope it can beat this.  In Arizona I hoped to get so really good authentic mexican.  This wasn't  it!

I1Vi2w6x-p6Db2kydEwriA.text: Must eat here. Place is. Little small but there is a sizable patio area. Food is outstanding. Great staff too. Very friendly.

JfCpdyU6x_ZNJjrmBt-fhg.text: I thoroughly enjoyed my first visit to Frank and Lupe's! They have an awesome menu, extremely reasonable on their prices, and delicious margaritas. The service was pretty good and the food came out quickly. I would love to come back when it's a bit warmer to enjoy their outdoor patio. Thanks for a great experience! We'll be back for sure!

bneJQYkL8Kp9JzUEB5fJug.text: Big stars for Frank and Lupe not banning me for life.  After knocking not one but three drinks on the ground, all three producing shards of broken Negro Modelo glass, one would think they'd send a goon squad over to whisk my Winter Beer Festival attending ass out the door, throwing me into the street like the town drunk in some old western movie.  Nope. What did they do? Instead, they bring me replacement drinks free of charge. Go figure. Like I needed any more beer, right?  I suggest ordering the #4 combination dinner. I managed to get a couple bites, (which was pretty damned tasty) but most of it wound up on my white polo shirt. Weird how white attracts large amounts of Mexican food. I looked like an art-deco work in progress.   Frank and Lupe, you have a really nice establishment.  Your food (what I can remember of it) is tasty, and your servers are super polite, but you really should have banned me for life, or at the very least, called the police on me or something.  Anyways, I'm going to do you guys a big favor and self-impose a "Banned-for-life" on me.  It's the least I can do to return the favor.   BTW, we were both lucky I found your receipt in my cargo shorts this morning, otherwise I'd never know the name of the place to ban myself from.

FOpNeBCB2EaauaiFMsKi8Q.text: Great food. Nice staff. Chicken Mole Enchiladas were great. Wife and kid both had plates with shredded beef. It was really good!

Tlm9XgnVWWDJ1Q2raH49BQ.text: This place is awesome great margaritas!! Food is great as well! The service is very good. Do not pass this place up!!

oHWQXk2v1hWJlKdhmhdc9A.text: Absolutely the best ceviche!!! And amazing Margaritas!! Service is always good and this place is family owned!! If you have a hankering for authentic Mexican food, this is your place!!

gVNSlJFckpdIiik0Ugf0LQ.text: Terrible service. One star for decorations but took nearly 15 minutes to even order food, servers sat us over in a corner and seemed to serve other customers  that came in later before even looking over at our table. I guess they thought we weren't going to tip well :\

mox8ZqLpsKxBs4l4E0W3zA.text: Frank and Lupe's is classic Old Town. It is everything you want in that old town Arizona quick taco and margarita hangout feel. Best chips and salsa for miles and miles!!

Uf3j1XwB9WBagSHELaX0jA.text: I've reviewed F&L's before - Food's good 4*, portions are a little smaller than you might expect.  I clean my plate every time.  How many Mexican restaurant's can you say that about?  I've had bad experiences here TWICE when using internet coupons or certificates.  The 1st time, I was told that the restaurant was no longer accepting that particular certificate.  I had just purchased those coupons about a month before.  Now, I PAID money for those certificates, but, it was a discounted amount, so I sucked it up and threw my two remaining certificates (and money) away.  Now, a week ago, I got a notice that a Deal Chicken I had purchased for F&L was expiring.  I buy a lot of online Coupons (Groupon type), and I don't remember what I bought where or if I used it or not.  I checked online, and the coupon site said my certificate was good.  So, we trotted down to Old Town for dinner and when I presented my certificate, they said it had already been used.  Apparently, they log their certificates on paper and DON'T update the websites issuing them.  We were the 3rd table that night trying to redeem a coupon that had been used before.  The manager came over and apologized, but it was really too late.  We had a bad experience for no reason, other than the owner's refusal to log coupons online as used.

1ovWhmIcSLf95uWb488DDg.text: I love this place! I come every time I am in from Seattle. I love the enchiladas with both green and red sauce. Truly fantastic and very authentic!

YtaK2RNsMdY7NL3KhFOfUA.text: One of my favorite Mexican restaurants in Scottsdale. It is a small place; 4 tables and bar in main dinning room and 10 tables in the side room. But ask if there is seating outside. If you go out the front door and take a short walk to the back of the building through the parking lot, you will find a great patio and a second in door seating area. Great chips and salsa too.

oSMDa6DQtUXnAcvnlx_Kpw.text: I brought my group into this restaurant after being recommended by the concierge at our hotel. They even made the reservation for us. I was standing next to the concierge as they made the reservation and gave them the details. They told her it was no problem having a party that size. When we arrived, we were told there was no reservation and they "don't even accept them". But, they would make room. Other than our group there only about a dozen people in there anyway.  Every member of their staff was snotty and rude. When I asked to talk to the manager I was told they did not have one and there was no one in charge. (That was evident). Finally, I told them we would just leave and they told me to "wait to talk to the manager". After waiting ten minutes to speak with whoever was in charge, I was told by the snottiest bartender I have ever met, "I need to go in the back" if I wanted to speak with him. He told me they did know of the reservation and he would handle it.  So, obviously the other three people lied to me. We had 1 server and one busboy for a party of 35 and they knew the day before to add staff.  Isn't that the purpose of a reservation for a party of that size? It took almost 30 minutes to get water and drinks and place an order.  After tasting the food, I wish it had never come. Taco Bell would have been a better choice. The staff was so rude I am guessing it was intentional.  I would hope the owner reads Yelp because his restaurant is a disaster. I have this event every quarter here in Scottsdale and will never frequent this restaurant again. Plus, I will diligently alert anyone else via Social Media that Taco Bell is abetter choice for Mexican food in Scottsdale.  There are far too many choices of great restaurants in Old Town Scottsdale.  Frank & Lupe's is the worst restaurant experience I have had.

w4gT6FcmT31xT64q3FB9bw.text: Yum off the charts. I was moaning from their shredded beef  tacos. Some of the best I have ever had and I am surrounded by mexican joints.  Prices were reasonable especially for the higher end drinks.  The location near the art galleries makes for a perfect date night. It is also super charming inside and on the patio.  This will be my Scottsdale go to place.  Am so jealous of the locales that they get this place in their hood!

7PPIu8dmw_aWVK-A76GTVA.text: I like this little restaurant. The food is affordable, the waiter was funny and very friendly, and they appeared to have a cute back patio with misters for those hotter days. The food was fine, but the most memorable part was the service! Also the cheesy rice and beans on the side and the salsa are very good!

KOsoN9zoa9LbsX8hkoQ6yw.text: Friendliest wait staff in a long time. Good food and reasonable prices. For a casual evening with friends ask to sit outside on the patio as the atmosphere back there is the best. We recently had a fun time there with a group of friends. The portions are large enough to share or take some home and the pitcher of margaritas the best.

9nBpsOx6qXbVJOxEkztSrA.text: So, this place is just all right. My wife liked the atmosphere, but I found it to be a bit too bar-ish for my taste. The dining room is extremely small, so if you don't want to inadvertently eavesdrop on everybody in there you'd better go elsewhere. Also, the bathroom's "outside and around the corner;" kinda inconvenient.  The food's not too bad. The salsa served with the chips is tasty; more savory than most places. Food portions are good, and I was surprised to see my chimichanga overfilled with beef- so it's a reasonable value.  Service is "eh." We were acknowledged and all our needs met, but just kinda felt like they could care less if we were there or not.  Not really sure why "Old Mexico" is in the title of the restaurant, though; like I said, it's a very bar-ish atmosphere playing mostly modern music and serving the general Mexican bill o' fare.  Still looking for the Mexican place that will knock my socks off in the Phoenix area.

pmwysrxW2K7X5EgaWPZjdQ.text: We were visiting from out of town and lucked into one of the best southwestern meals I've ever had at Frank & Lupe's.  They were busy tonight but the owner found us a table.  I was particularly impressed with the way he was supporting the staff, working side by side, in spite of being dressed in a suit.  He was clearing tables and at the same time acting as the host seating guests.  Clearly here's a guy who is proud of his restaurant and I can see why.  The kitchen did an outstanding job in spite of the pressure of a spring Saturday night crowd.  A local couple told us they eat there 3 times a week.  Great food and very reasonable prices.  Be sure to check out the patio in the back if the weather cooperates.

7qo_HYOkm82V0-GbFUutuQ.text: The food at this place was quite greasy and lacking flavor. I wouldn't call this place authentic as it's just a lot of fried food with greasy yellow cheese. I do NOT recommend this for visitors looking for authentic Mexican food.

C5kpcrauRMQHxHgOIesKoA.text: I give Frank and Lupes a solid A-OK. I go to Frank and Lupes when the patio is open which is during the peak season and before it gets too hot out. The patio is kind of like a patio in Mexico with the beach in the background. This patio might not have the beach, but it has everything else to the equation, including pitchers of margaritas and a great atmosphere for a weekend meal of decent Mexican food.  This isn't fine dining. This isn't even kind of fine dining. But this is a fun option for Mexican food and it's a couple levels nicer than a Mexican bar in town. So if you go into it with these expectations, you'll have fun.   I like Frank and Lupes for a casual night out that involves margaritas and guacamole, but especially for their soapapillas. Their soapapillas are really good. Their guac is decent but creamier rather than chunky. I prefer chunky guac but can handle this creamy one. For the entrees, everything is pretty generic Mexican food but the item that stands out most on the menu to me is the #8, the Poblano Creamy Chicken Enchiladas. It has this creamy green sauce to it and the meal definitely stands out from all the other normal Mexican food dishes.   So now I've shared my secret spot for a beach vacation to Mexico when I can't quite find myself to the beach itself.

O3L9ti_CJwtsBIlCn3jDdg.text: Went on a Friday for happy hour with a friend.  The food absolutely rocked!  Had the chimi with a red sauce and it had some of the best seasoned beef packed throughout.  Rice & beans were standard and acceptable.  Margarita was good and reasonably priced for hh, though the server added salt when i asked for none.  Only negative in the experience was the heat in the enclosed patio.  They have fans and Ac but it either wasn't working or they didn't have it turned up enough.  Will be back for the food and drinks though!

s4P24yoj4km5nuimy1J62A.text: We were having high hopes for this place because the place looked authentic.  First of all the staff is very friendly and service is pretty good.  Our disappointment was with the food.  The chips were good, but the salsa was kinda bland.  I had the tostada and my husband had the carnitas plate.  Once again the food was bland. We were expecting some flavors and maybe a little kick to the dishes.  One more thing that was good, the beers were cheap.

_TgeObTil47xxmTYT93isA.text: I recently visited Frank & Lupes in Old Town Scottsdale for a dinner with friends, and was very disappointed with the experience.  During the evening, our service was quite slow and erratic.  Our party was charged for small servings of chips and salsa, which they brought to our table before we ordered anything.  Some in our party were surprisingly charged for premium alcohol even though they ordered house/well quality.  Even worse, the salsa we were served was watery and of overall poor quality.  We had friends at another table, and they echoed the same sentiments.    I will not be returning to this restaurant ever again!!  All diners are forewarned!!

Gm7GALeY5jJ2W2cs6WPGwQ.text: I love Frank and Lupe's!  They have a great patio!  Excellent food selections and helpful staff.  The spices and combinations have a very southwestern or New Mexican fee.   I have been here many times and have not had a bad meal.  Very reasonable prices as well!

CsHH1CwatszbmrWxC0w05g.text: Probably one of the better chimichanga I've eaten.  On top of its decent size, it was packed full of beef!  I definitely got my money's worth with this item.  Although we got lucky, I can imagine the wait to eat here being extremely long.  The restaurant is pretty tiny and parking is kind of tough in the area.

gfBlY-e1Hzp-38xP2HghJQ.text: Marginal at best.   I expected great things based on the Yelp reviews and from asking locals.  What a disappointment.  I was not turned off by the dated decor; it's rather charming in its own funky way.  Besides, you get some of the best Mexican food at the no-frills places.  However, this food was sub par.  The salsa was watery and I could have made the enchiladas much better myself.  Also, I was less than impressed with my margaritas.  I tried two different varieties to be sure :) but that was a waste.  Absolutely nothing stood out about this place.    Where, oh where is the great Mexican food in Phoenix/Scottsdale?

rjZbdgEkz34OL4R9spR2Vw.text: We had a great time here!  Our server (Celine) was top notch - she was attentive but not overbearing and made sure everything was to our liking.  Enchiladas with poblano cream sauce were excellent. Great service, good margaritas, good chips n salsa, really nice, easy-going atmosphere.

So13q0plum92TLUABIpw_A.text: Frank and Lupe's is an oasis hidden amongst a sea of snooty.  Tucked back in the back is one of the best patio's around.  The drinks are strong, and quite tasty.  The food is delicious!  I had the carnitas stuffed sopapillas last time, and I'm still dreaming of them...  This is a must-stop for me every time I'm in Old Town!

UQSeIv8j2EDtKyzmd_btXw.text: Best Mexican food in old town for sure. Loves this place and the authenticity. Felt like I was on vacation!

z8K6Iamm3ArfKUWN2P4jMQ.text: It's not my fave, but it's not awful.  A couple friends drug me here earlier today... I was wanting basic tacos and/or light apps and good margaritas, like what you'd find on a happy hour menu, but the girlfriend wanted "good mexican food" and didn't want to try a new spot fearing she might be left disappointed. They (she and her man) advised me if I hadn't had the cheese crisp and F & L's, i hadn't yet lived. A cheese crisp was ordered and they were correct in that it is not the crappy thin tortilla with burnt cheese that i've seen in other establishments. Its almost a crust and there is a nice amount of cheese, with a lil pico, shredded lettuce and sour cream to accompany. It was fairly spicy and tasted like jalapenos had been rubbed all over it, but it was a good spicy.  Much to my dismay, there was no happy hour on the weekend.  =/  I ordered a large house margarita. It wasn't great. I looooove margaritas and this one leaves you wanting to go somewhere for a good house margarita (like Cien Agave?)  For food, i had the chicken chimichanga with both red and green sauces (no fancy taco creations here folks, just traditional mexican food.) Red is spicy! Green is almost flavorless in comparison. The rice was decent and the beans were really good. They were the one thing I finished on my plate! I should also give props to the server as he was prompt and attentive! F & L's is decent, but not my cup of tea. I'll stick to the taquerias from now on!
